title: Workforce Development Manager
description_html:
Workforce Development Manager = Remote 

 

Founded in 1980, the International Facility Management Association (IFMA) is the world’s largest, most widely recognized association for facility management (FM) professionals. IFMA supports over 25,000 members across 140 countries, 122 chapters, 16 industry-specific councils, and 7 communities of practice. A key contributor to the development of international FM standards, IFMA works with decision makers to inform FM-related policy. IFMA provides career resources and continuing education, offers three industry-respected credentials, maintains the largest repository of FM-related content on the web, and hosts year-round global events. With a vision to lead the future of the built environment to make the world a better place, IFMA believes in the benefit of international diversity, inclusion, and social equity, recognizing that sustainability, resilience, and responsible environmental stewardship are paramount. For more information, visit ifma.org and our LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook, Threads, X, and Flickr pages. Follow IFMA’s Connected FM podcast and blog for expert insights on trending industry topics.

 

We are seeking a Workforce Development Manager to play a vital role in advancing the facility management industry by leading initiatives that attract new talent, strengthen career pathways, and deepen employer engagement with IFMA and the IFMA Foundation. You will develop innovative workforce solutions, integrate technology, and build strategic partnerships to expand opportunities globally. You will promote facility management as a career of choice and help shape the industry's future by supporting individuals in creating successful, rewarding careers.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

We value the time and efforts of our employees. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by an annual competitive compensation of $80,000 to $85,000 annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Comprehensive health benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) / retirement plan with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life & disability insurance
  • Flexible financial options: Flexible spending account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA)
  • Work/Life Balance: Paid time off and holidays, Flexible schedule, and remote work/telecommuting options
  • Workplace perks: Employee assistance program, Professional development assistance, and more!

 

Additionally, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees to learn, grow, and thrive within the company. We strive to create a collaborative and creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To be successful as a Workforce Development Manager, you should have:

  • 5+ years of experience in workforce development, outreach, partnership development, or industry promotion, with a Bachelor’s degree preferred in public policy, marketing, business administration, human resources, or related fields.
  • Solid project management skills with the ability to manage multiple initiatives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Solid written, verbal, and presentation skills in English, with the ability to interpret technical, financial, and legal documents; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.
  • Solid technical expertise with Microsoft Office Suite, CRM systems, Canva, and Adobe software.
  • Ability to travel domestically up to 10% and adapt to diverse work environments while maintaining high-quality performance.

 

Your responsibilities as the Workforce Development Manager will include:

  • Develop and implement strategic outreach initiatives to engage employers, job seekers, educators, and community organizations, promoting facility management as a career of choice.
  • Design and manage targeted career and training programs for high-priority populations, creating resources and partnerships to guide individuals into facility management roles.
  • Foster employer and community engagement by building collaborations with industry, educational institutions, workforce boards, and nonprofits to strengthen the talent pipeline.
  • Drive revenue and funding opportunities through sponsorships, grant applications, and initiatives that expand participation in IFMA professional development and membership programs.
  • Leverage data and evaluation tools to measure program impact, refine workforce strategies, and inform the development of scalable, globally replicable initiatives.

 

Join Our Mission to Shape the Future of Facility Management!

Bring your expertise, creativity, and passion for workforce development to drive innovative programs, build powerful partnerships, and inspire the next generation of industry leaders.

 

We anticipate that the application window will close in 60 days.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment with the Local Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: Warehouse / Driver / Material Handler
description_html:
Warehouse / Driver / Material Handler

Full-time permanent - $20.00 per hour!

Recruitment Bonus $500 after 90 days!

 
Interested? Text airport13 to 832-234-2464 to start the process!

 

        Rapidly growing company

        Employer-paid health insurance

        Paid holidays

        Easy parking onsite at the warehouse

        Get paid to work out!

 

Bradford Airport Logistics is #1 in our industry. We manage vendor relationships for all consumable goods entering LaGuardia Airport. We also deliver these goods in a secure, safe, and efficient manner so our customers have what they want when they want it.

 

We are currently seeking a Warehouse / Driver / Material Handler for our receiving and redistribution operations center located in Astoria, Queens. This is a physically demanding position ideal for those who like to stay fit and active while providing outstanding customer service for our airport partners.

 

At Bradford, we take pride in being the best, which is why we hire the best. We're looking for people who are as passionate as we are about leading the logistics industry. We offer an innovative and dynamic company culture, with a clear path to promotion based on merit. Find out more about us at www.airportlogistics.org.

 

Responsibilities:

        Accurately receive and process inbound materials

        Safely pick, stack and load material for delivery

        Safely drive a box truck (non-CDL) around the airport

        Accurately operate a handheld scanner

        Interact with our customers and provide great service

        Work together with other team members

        Provide input to improve existing processes and procedures

 

Qualifications:

        One year previous warehouse, logistics or material-handling experience preferred

        High School diploma or GED

        Ability to lift up to 75 pounds repeatedly

        Good driving record and valid driver's license

        NY State Security Guard License preferred

        Flexibility to work early-morning shifts (starting from 4:00 AM-8:00 AM)

        Ability to pass the airport background check
 

What's in it for you?

        Competitive pay starting at $20.00 per hour

        $500 after 90 days

        Significant opportunity for career growth

        Professional development plan that positions you for success

        Annual pay increases

        Employer-paid health insurance (excellent UHC $1,500 deductible coverage)

        401K with employer contribution

        Paid holidays, sick days, and vacation



Interested? Text airport13 to 832-234-2464 to start the process!



*All job offers are contingent upon passing a pre-employment drug screen (excluding marijuana), airport background check and clean driving record review.



We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Virtual Physical Science Teacher, Grades 7-12 – Indiana Statewide
description_html:
Our Mission: The mission of the Hoosier College and Career Academy is to provide personalized, virtual learning opportunities to all Indiana students regardless of circumstances and abilities.
  
Our Vision: Through virtual platforms, research-based academic standards, and meaningful partnerships, we will prepare today’s  learners for tomorrow’s ever-changing career and academic opportunities. 
  
Join with us in helping students in grades 7-12 reach their true potential and enjoy teaching from the comfort and safety of your home!  Signing bonuses are available for some positions.


 

Virtual Physical Science Teacher, Grades 7-12 - Indiana Statewide

Hoosier College and Career Academy


 

SUMMARY: The position of teacher at Hoosier College and Career Academy is a highly qualified, state-certified teacher responsible for delivering specific course content in an on-line environment.

 

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor's degree AND
  • Three (3) years of teaching experience AND
  • Meet requirements for Highly Qualified Teacher (HQT)
  • Licensing: Appropriate licensing qualifying you to teach Physical Science

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • On-line teaching experience
  • High Ability, Special Education or other endorsements

 

Certificates and Licenses: Active Indiana state teaching certification for appropriate content area and grade level.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Learns the entire K12 curriculum for assigned grade levels and is able to demonstrate knowledge of how state standards align with it;
  • Understands how both diverse and unique characteristics of students and their families impact required support;
  • Augments course content according to prescribed policies and procedures using appropriate asynchronous and synchronous tools;
  • Create, develop and submit lesson plans weekly;
  • Orients students to their course, communicates requirements, sets and enforces deadlines, maintains regular office hours and conducts instructional sessions;
  • Takes ownership for student’s academic progress and attendance communicating high expectations and showing active interest in student’s achievement;
  • Collaborates with grade-level team, administration, interventionists, Special Education teachers and instructional coaches regarding instruction, resources, interventions and data-driven decision making to support student success
  • Provides instruction to help students master K12 curricular objectives
  • Prepares students for high stakes standardized tests;
  • Establishes and maintains positive rapport with families and regularly communicates with students and learning coaches/parents to keep them adequately apprised of the student’s progress and issues;
  • Supports learning coaches/parents with student curricular and instructional issues in a virtual classroom environment, balancing the flexibility of the K12 curriculum with proper enforcement of Academy policies and procedures;
  • Grades submitted, required student work and maintains grade book;
  • Generates formal and informal reports regarding student progress, alerting administrators to concerns about student performance and progress;
  • Creates and manages a home office;
  • Supports students and learning coaches with the set-up and maintenance of their learning environment including basic computer troubleshooting.
  • Utilizes data analysis and data driven instruction
  • Follows Staff Handbook expectations

 

OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The below statements are intended to describe the general nature and scope of work being performed by this position. This is not a complete listing of all responsibilities, duties and/or skills required; other duties may be assigned.

  • Proctors site-based exams;
  • Follow the Community Events Policy in Staff handbook
  • Collects and analyzes formative and summative assessments
  • Teaches scheduled Class Connect sessions for specific subject areas and homeroom
  • Collaborates with peers in order to provide a positive experience for students;
  • Builds community by contributing to school message boards, newsletters and events;
  • Travels to and participates in staff meetings, school outings, marketing events, state testing, professional development sessions, and other experiences;
  • Maintains records regarding students in accordance with school policy and state requirements; prepares reports regarding students and classroom matters as directed;
  • Provides direct instruction to students as needed
  • Participates in committees as required.

 

OTHER REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Strong interpersonal skills emphasizing tact, promptness, patience and courtesy; ability to establish a professional, effective rapport with students
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, Microsoft Office, Power Point and Outlook, as well as Internet research methods and report writing techniques; Utilizes computer software associated with curriculum; obtains additional training in technology as required
  • Able to read data and determine what steps are needed to assist students academically on an individual and/or classroom basis
  • Able to adapt learning plans to meet different needs and learning styles; create an instructional and whole class environment favorable to learning and personal growth
  • Communicate effectively both orally and in writing
  • Demonstrates the use of good judgment in decision-making
  • Great organizational and time management skills
  • Customer service orientation to include promptness and appropriateness of responses to needs and requests of students and learning coaches
  • Understanding of applicable sections of the State Education Code and other pertinent regulations
  • Obtains additional licensing as required
  • Ability to travel within and between assigned geographic areas to support students;
  • Attend regularly scheduled meetings and participate in school activities, open houses and orientations
  • Ability to pass required background check

 

To Apply for This Position:

Please follow this link into the Indiana Department of Education's career site Nimble to create your Profile, upload your resume and any other documents that you wish to have considered, and apply directly for this position - https://app.hirenimble.com/jobview/94336. 


Benefits:

In return for your hard work, Hoosier College and Career Academy offers an attractive compensation package of salary and an outstanding benefits package.


We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Virtual History Teacher, Grades 7-12 - Indiana Statewide
description_html:
Our New Mission: The mission of the Hoosier College and Career Academy is to provide personalized, virtual learning opportunities to all Indiana students regardless of circumstances and abilities.
  
Our New Vision: Through virtual platforms, research-based academic standards, and meaningful partnerships, we will prepare today’s  learners for tomorrow’s ever-changing career and academic opportunities.
  
Join with us in helping students in grades 7-12 reach their true potential and enjoy teaching from the comfort and safety of your home! Signing bonuses are available for some positions.


 

Virtual History Teacher, Grades 7-12 - Indiana Statewide

Hoosier College and Career Academy


 

The Virtual History Teacher, Grades 7-12 will plan, carry out, evaluate, teach, and supervise instructional lessons and activities in a high school Social Studies class through Blackboard Connect, the virtual classroom. The teacher will also be responsible for small groups and daily monitoring of the school’s universal screener programs.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Devote your undivided attention to students and families during operating hours from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday, with a 30-minute lunch break
  • Learn the K12 curriculum in its entirety for assigned grade levels
  • Demonstrate knowledge of the Indiana Academic Standards and how both align to the K12 curriculum
  • Annually map and review grade level/subject area content to ensure K12 curriculum is aligned to the Indiana Academic Standard.
  • Understand overall diversity of assigned families and individual characteristics of students/parents; specifically, how this impacts support needed
  • Create and develop weekly lesson plans
  • Collaborate with grade level/department team, administration, Interventionists, Special Education teachers, and Instructional Coaches to support student success
  • Support parents with student curricular and instructional issues
  • Monitor student academic progress and attendance daily
  • Collect and analyze data on student progress for records and data meetings
  • Participate in grade level/department data meetings
  • Create action steps based on student data
  • Form and maintain data-driven small group sessions for re-teaching and enrichment of content.
  • Communicate grades/progress with students, Learning Coaches, and appropriate staff by e-mail, phone, and in course announcements
  • Prepare students for state standardized testing
  • Attend IEP meetings as required
  • Utilize the TAP Teacher Evaluation rubric as a guide for effective instruction
  • Fulfill any other duties as assigned by administration

 

Required Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor's degree AND
  • Three (3) years of experience teaching at the high school level preferred AND
  • Meet requirements for Highly Qualified Teacher (HQT) in subject area under No Child Left Behind (NCLB)
  • Certificates and Licenses: Appropriate state teaching certification for MS and HS Social Studies with concentrations in US History, world history, government and economics plus licensing in World Perspectives and Government (required)

 

To Apply for This Position:

Please follow this link into the Indiana Department of Education's career site Nimble to create your Profile, upload your resume and any other document that you wish to have considered, and apply for this position - https://app.hirenimble.com/jobview/94329.


Benefits: 

In return for your hard work, Hoosier College and Career Academy offers an attractive combination of salary and outstanding benefits. Salary will be commensurate with experience and education level.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Virtual High School Computer Science Teacher - Indiana Statewide
description_html:
Hoosier College and Career Academy is a tuition-free, online public school serving students across Indiana. We are committed to providing a personalized, high-quality education that prepares students for college, career, and life. Our innovative virtual learning environment empowers students to thrive academically while receiving the support they need to succeed.



Virtual High School Computer Science Teacher - Indiana Statewide



Hoosier College and Career Academy is seeking a passionate and knowledgeable Virtual High School Computer Science Teacher to educate and inspire students in foundational and advanced computing concepts. The ideal candidate will provide engaging instruction in Principles of Computing and Computing Foundations for a Digital Age, equipping students with essential digital literacy, programming skills, and an understanding of modern computing systems.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver interactive lessons on computing fundamentals, programming logic, cybersecurity, database technology, operating systems, and cloud implementations.
  • Teach students foundational computing concepts, including networks and the internet, data analysis, algorithms, and problem-solving strategies.
  • Guide students in coding and script development to solve real-world problems using logic, flowcharting, and algorithm design.
  • Foster critical thinking, collaboration, and innovation through project-based learning and technology-driven activities.
  • Integrate current events and emerging computing trends into curriculum to keep students engaged with real-world applications.
  • Utilize and teach Adobe products, cybersecurity fundamentals, and other relevant tools to support student learning.
  • Prepare students for AP Computer Science or dual-credit coursework, ensuring alignment with college-level expectations when applicable.
  • Provide mentorship and career guidance related to computer science fields, including industry certifications, internships, and higher education pathways.
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of advancements in computer science and education technologies.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Education, or related field.
  • Teaching certification required (AP/Dual Credit certification preferred).
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or JavaScript is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of cybersecurity, databases, and cloud computing concepts.
  • Experience working with Adobe products is preferred.
  • Excellent communication and classroom management skills.
  • Commitment to fostering an inclusive, technology-driven learning environment.


Preferred Skills:

  • Familiarity with educational technology and virtual learning tools.
  • Experience designing engaging hands-on projects in computer science.
  • Ability to adapt teaching methods to different learning styles and grade levels.
  • Enthusiasm for guiding students toward college, career, and industry opportunities in computing.


To Apply for This Position:

Please follow this link into the Indiana Department of Education career site Nimble to create your profile, upload your resume and any other document that you wish to have considered, and apply directly for this position - https://app.hirenimble.com/jobview/88636.


Benefits:

In return for your hard work, Hoosier College and Career Academy offers an attractive combination of salary and outstanding benefits.  Salary will be commensurate with experience and education level.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Universal Banker Associate - Jackson, MS
description_html:
Universal Banker Associate - Full Time

$18.00 - $20.00 per hour

 

The Universal Banker Associate provides first-line, quality customer service through face-to-face performance of primary bank transactions. This position will also utilize communication opportunities to offer additional bank services and products.


 

What does it take to become a Universal Banker Associate?

  • Customer service skills for greeting and assisting customers in person, by phone, and at the drive-thru.
  • Cash handling experience, including processing deposits, withdrawals, and checks while balancing the cash drawer daily.
  • Ability to open new deposit accounts and process ATM/night depository deposits.
  • Sales skills to identify and initiate opportunities for promoting bank products.
  • Attention to detail for processing and proofing daily transactions according to guidelines.
  • Must be able to travel or be assigned to any branch location within the local market.

 

Experience: 

  • A high school diploma or general education degree (GED) is required.
  • Two years of related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience. 
  • Experience in a personal banker/customer service representative-type role is strongly preferred.

 

Liberty’s Bank and Trust’s Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
  • Solid Work/Life Balance, including PTO and paid holidays
  • Financial wellness, including an FSA 401K and match, Educational Reimbursement, and Life Insurance
  • Family assistance, including Adoption Assistance and EAP/Health and Welfare Assistance
  • Growth opportunities, including Training and Development and Leadership Development
  • Substantial perks, including Online Marketplace* discounts on a variety of goods and services, ERG/ Ambassador Group, and Free and reduced-rate bank services 

 

Liberty Bank and Trust, America’s first billion-dollar Black-owned bank, has proudly served communities across 11 states for over 50 years. We are building a team of mission-driven individuals committed to empowering people, businesses, and communities to thrive. By providing access to financial tools and services, we help achieve goals like homeownership, business growth, and financial education. Whether it’s a community, a burgeoning business, or untapped talent, we believe in the possibility of financial freedom. To find out more about our financial solutions and our community impact, visit us at www.libertybank.net

 

If you’re looking for a company where your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your impact is acknowledged, Liberty Bank is the place for you.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Treasury Management Sales Officer
description_html:
Treasury Management Sales Officer

 

Our client is a forward-thinking national bank with a relationship-driven culture and a commitment to innovative, secure financial solutions. As the Treasury Management Sales Officer for a national bank, you will be responsible for the steady growth of the Treasury Management (TM) portfolio through prospecting, marketing, educating, and implementing the Bank’s commercial depository services and treasury management products to both existing commercial customers and prospects.   Success will be measured by calling efforts and new product implementations.  

 

Job Duties

Treasury Solutions and Sales

  • Recommend and implement treasury management products to existing and prospective commercial customers such as ACH, wire services, remote deposit capture, fraud prevention, and online banking solutions.
  • Partners with commercial lenders and relationship managers on joint client calls to identify opportunities, deepen relationships, and ensure customers satisfaction remains high.
  • Conduct proactive client reviews to assess cash flow needs, operational processes, and treasury risks.
  • Prepare pricing proposals, product demonstrations, and presentations tailored to client needs.
  • Reports to the President.

Implementation and Service Support

  • Coordinate onboarding of treasury management services to ensure timely and accurate implementation.
  • Responsible for obtaining customer signed agreements for all TM products and services used.
  • Provide onboarding training and education to clients on treasury management platforms and best practices.

Reporting and Collaboration

  • Prepare sales pipeline, revenue, and performance reports as required.
  • Collaborate with internal teams including operations, treasury management operations, credit, compliance, and technology.

 

Requirements

  • Qualified candidates should hold a bachelor’s degree in a business-related field and have a minimum of five years of experience in bank treasury management sales and service.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must.
  • This position requires an understanding of bank TM products and services.
  • Awareness of regulatory issues related to bank TM products and services.

 

Comprehensive Total Rewards Offering:

Our client offers a competitive total rewards package designed to attract, retain, and support high-performing professionals. The package includes:

  • Salary commensurate with experience
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401(k) plan with employer matching contributions
  • Life and disability insurance coverage
  • Health savings and flexible spending accounts
  • Paid time off 

 

Beyond compensation, they emphasize a culture of collaboration, professional growth, and meaningful employee engagement.

 

About Our Client:

Our client is a well-established national bank known for combining stability with innovation. Operating with a customer-centric mindset, the organization offers a full suite of commercial banking and treasury management solutions designed to help businesses operate more efficiently and securely. With a collaborative internal culture and an emphasis on long-term relationships, our client empowers its teams to grow portfolios, deepen client engagement, and contribute meaningfully to the institution’s continued success.

 

The MINT National Bank

 

Drive the Future of Treasury Solutions

If you’re energized by building commercial relationships, delivering innovative Treasury Management solutions, and turning opportunity into measurable growth, this is your moment. Apply now and help shape how businesses move, manage, and protect their money.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Teller / Universal Banker Associate - Kansas City, KS
description_html:
Teller / Universal Banker Associate - Full Time

$18.00 - $20.00 Per hour

 

Liberty Bank and Trust, America’s first billion-dollar Black-owned bank, has proudly served communities across 11 states for over 50 years. We are building a team of mission-driven individuals committed to empowering people, businesses, and communities to thrive. By providing access to financial tools and services, we help achieve goals like homeownership, business growth, and financial education. Whether it’s a community, a burgeoning business, or untapped talent, we believe in the possibility of financial freedom. To find out more about our financial solutions and our community impact, visit us at: www.libertybank.net

 

If you’re looking for a company where your ideas matter, your growth is supported, and your impact is acknowledged—Liberty Bank is the place for you.


 

The Teller / Universal Banker Associate provides first-line, quality customer service through face-to-face performance of primary bank transactions. This position will also utilize communication opportunities to offer additional bank services and products.


 

What does it take to become a Teller / Universal Banker Associate?

  • Customer service skills for greeting and assisting customers in person, by phone, and at the drive-thru.
  • Cash handling experience, including processing deposits, withdrawals, and checks while balancing the cash drawer daily.
  • Ability to open new deposit accounts and process ATM/night depository deposits.
  • Sales skills to identify and initiate opportunities for promoting bank products.
  • Attention to detail for processing and proofing daily transactions according to guidelines.

 

Experience: 

  • A high school diploma or general education degree (GED) is required.
  • Two years related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience. 
  • Experience in a personal banker/customer service representative-type role is strongly preferred.

 

Liberty’s Bank and Trust’s Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks: 

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
  • Solid Work/Life Balance, including PTO; paid holidays; personal and sick days
  • Financial wellness, including an FSA; 401K and match; Educational Reimbursement, and Life Insurance
  • Family assistance, including Adoption Assistance and EAP/Health and Welfare Assistance
  • Growth opportunities, including Training and Development and Leadership Development
  • Substantial perks, including Online Marketplace* discounts on a variety of goods and services, ERG/ Ambassador Group, and free and reduced-rate bank services 

 

We do our best to ensure that Liberty Bank and Trust is an incredible place to work and build a career. We want you to learn, grow, and share in the success you help create. There is also a future opportunity for growth within the company.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Tax Manager
description_html:
Tax Manager

 

Our client, a forward-thinking accounting and tax advisory firm, is seeking an experienced Tax Manager to support its continued growth. In this fully remote role, the Tax Manager will be a licensed CPA or Enrolled Agent who thrives in a leadership capacity, enjoys client-facing work, and wants to make a meaningful impact beyond compliance. You will lead tax engagements end to end, providing strategic guidance to clients and mentoring junior team members. This role blends hands-on tax leadership with collaboration, innovation, and a strong commitment to client success.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

Our client values their employees’ time and efforts. Their competitive compensation of $130,000 to $170,000 annually, depending on experience, performance-based bonuses, and an extensive benefits package, enhances their commitment to your success. Our client’s benefits package includes:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Professional development and continuing education support, paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work choices provided

 

Plus, they work to maintain an environment where employees can learn, grow, and make a direct impact in a growing firm that values both technical excellence and human connection. The firm fosters a collaborative culture in which individuals are encouraged to contribute to processes, decisions, planning, and the overall workplace.

 

Required Qualifications: 

  • Active CPA or Enrolled Agent license.
  • 5+ years of progressive tax experience, including management and review of complex returns across multiple entity types.
  • Strong technical knowledge of U.S. federal and California tax law. 
  • High-level proficiency with business tax preparation software and Microsoft Office.

 

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (Master’s in Taxation preferred).
  • Multi-state experience preferred.
  • Experience using QuickBooks and Intuit ProConnect.

 

Your responsibilities as the Tax Manager will include:        

  • Oversee and manage tax compliance and filings across multiple entity types, including individuals and businesses.
  • Lead the preparation, review, and delivery of federal, state, and local tax returns.
  • Provide proactive tax planning, research complex tax issues, and deliver clear strategic guidance to clients.
  • Build and maintain strong client relationships through responsive, high-quality advisory service.
  • Supervise, mentor, and develop staff while staying current on tax law changes and contributing to firm growth.

 

About Our Client:

Our client partners with small businesses and entrepreneurs to deliver comprehensive accounting, tax compliance, and strategic advisory services. Known for blending deep technical expertise with a people-first mindset, the firm focuses on building trusted, long-term relationships while helping clients navigate complex financial and tax landscapes with confidence.

 

Ready to Lead and Make an Impact?

Step into a fully remote leadership role where your tax expertise drives real client outcomes and helps shape a growing, people-centered firm. Apply now to bring your insight, initiative, and passion for excellence to a team that values both precision and connection.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.


#PRO

title: Student Support Facilitator - Indianapolis, IN
description_html:
Student Support Facilitator

 

Schedule: 12-Month, Full-Time
Location: Office-Based (Indianapolis Area)
Reports To: Senior Manager of Operations

 

The Student Support Facilitator plays a vital role in supporting the operations team, administrators, and counselors. This position fosters strong relationships with students and families to address learning gaps and improve academic outcomes. The role requires up to 25% travel for testing and meetings.

 

Essential Functions - Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Deliver Title I-required communications to students and families
  • Support the Community Engagement Specialist with social media initiatives
  • Monitor attendance lines and address special attendance situations
  • Troubleshoot attendance and testing issues to assist families
  • Assist with assessment logistics and communications to parents and students
  • Provide updates and support to HCCA’s special populations group
  • Coordinate direct mailings, including progress reports, postcards, and testing information
  • Organize and support in-person events
  • Update student demographic information as needed
  • Process attendance adjustments based on monitoring and communications

 

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

 

Other Required Qualifications

  • Strong time-management and organizational skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, Excel, and web-based tools
  • Experience working with databases
  • Ability to travel up to 25%
  • Successful completion of required background checks

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • Demonstrated success in timely completion of tasks and projects
  • Ability to adapt to and learn new systems quickly
  • Strong initiative and innovative problem-solving skills

 

Work Environment

This is an office-based role located in the Indianapolis area, with approximately 25% travel required for testing and meetings. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

To Apply for This Position:

Please follow this link into the Indiana Department Of Education's career site Nimble to construct your profile, upload your resume and any other document that you wish to have considered, and apply directly for this position - https://app.hirenimble.com/jobview/94567.


Benefits:

In return for your hard work, Hoosier College and Career Academy offers an attractive combination of salary and outstanding benefits. Salary will be commensurate with experience and education level.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Staff Accountant - Hybrid
description_html:
Staff Accountant - Hybrid

 

Our client is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Staff Accountant to support their growing finance and accounting operations. This role plays a key part in ensuring financial accuracy, compliance, and operational efficiency as the organization continues to scale. As the Staff Accountant, you will collaborate across teams, manage core accounting processes, and help translate financial data into insights that support informed decision-making. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys working in a dynamic environment and wants to contribute to a mission-driven, technology-forward organization.

 

About Our Client:

Our client is a rapidly growing technology company that develops custom Artificial Intelligence solutions trained exclusively on carefully curated, organization-specific data to deliver secure, relevant, and responsible outcomes. Their AI powers custom cybersecurity platforms for organizations ranging from small and mid-sized businesses to large enterprises, while also supporting the healthcare industry through AI-enhanced diagnostic tools, health tracking, and wellness solutions. Driven by a team of experts committed to ethical, human-centered innovation, our client focuses on building technology that creates meaningful real-world impact.

 

Where Talent Is Recognized and Supported

Our client is intentional about building a workplace that rewards performance and supports personal and professional well-being. What they provide:

  • $65,000-85,000 annually, depending on experience, and equity in a well-funded, high-growth company
  • Medical, dental, vision, 401 (k)
  • Opportunity to revolutionize industry while using Artificial Intelligence as a tool that benefits rather than replaces humanity
  • Company-sponsored outings, tech talks, happy hours, and education
  • A diverse group of smart people with backgrounds from healthcare to tech to anthropology

 

Our client promotes a culture where employees are empowered to contribute ideas, take ownership, and grow alongside the organization.

 

To thrive, you should have:        

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field, with at least 2 years of experience in general accounting, financial reporting, or audit.
  • Working knowledge of GAAP, financial regulations, and standard accounting practices across general ledger, reconciliations, and reporting.
  • CPA or progress toward certification, or equivalent professional credential, preferred.
  • Proficiency with accounting software, ERP systems, and advanced functionality in Microsoft Excel and related financial tools.
  • Demonstrated capability in financial analysis, variance review, reconciliation, and accurate preparation of financial statements and supporting schedules.

 

How you’ll have an impact as the Staff Accountant:        

  • Maintain accurate financial records and manage the general ledger, including reconciliations and transaction processing.
  • Support month-end and year-end close, including preparation of financial statements and related reporting.
  • Analyze financial data, monitor budgets, and provide insights on trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Ensure compliance through strong internal controls, audit support, vendor oversight, and tax coordination.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to resolve discrepancies, improve processes, and support business objectives.

 

 

Step Into Impact

If you’re a detail-driven accounting professional who thrives in fast-moving, mission-led environments and wants your work to shape how a growing technology organization scales responsibly, this is your moment. Bring your expertise, curiosity, and precision, and help turn financial insight into real-world impact by applying today.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment, in accordance with the Yolo County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: Sr. Structural Project Manager
description_html:
Senior Structural Project Manager- Houston


Our client is seeking a Senior Structural Project Manager who is ready to make a meaningful impact — The Structural Project Manager will work with and lead and mentor a multidisciplinary team on projects across healthcare, industrial, government, corporate, and education markets. This role requires a licensed Professional Engineer (PE) with strong technical knowledge, project management expertise, and client-focused leadership. The Structural Project Manager will oversee design delivery, manage project

teams, and serve as a trusted advisor to clients while ensuring quality, budget, and schedule goals are met. This role blends structural design expertise with leadership skills that align with our company culture and core values.


Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

Our client values its employees and is committed to providing a supportive and rewarding work environment. With a competitive salary of $105,000 to $160,000, or more DOE, annually, relocation assistance, and potential for a performance bonus, they invest in the success and well-being of their team. Employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package that balances health, financial security, professional growth, and work-life flexibility, including:

  • Hybrid work schedule with limited monthly travel
  • 401(k) with company match
  • 100% employer-paid healthcare, dental, and vision for employees; partial coverage for spouses and families
  • Flexible paid time off, paid holidays, and generous parental leave
  • Professional development and educational assistance, including coaching, licensure fees, and specialized training programs
  • Team-building, social, and family-friendly events that foster collaboration and a positive culture


Our client prides itself on a culture that values work-life balance, professional growth, and making a positive impact in communities through innovative engineering solutions. Team members are supported in a collaborative, family-first environment where their contributions help deliver meaningful projects, exceed client expectations, and shape the built environment nationwide.


To succeed as the Senior Structural Project Manager, you should have:

  • Master’s degree in Structural, Architectural or Civil Engineering (structural emphasis) with 8–12+ years of progressive structural engineering and project management experience.
  • Licensed Professional Engineer (P.E.) in Texas or eligibility to obtain licensure within six months.
  • Advanced command of structural systems (steel, concrete, CMU, foundations, lateral/diaphragm systems), including progressive collapse checks, anchorage, and connections.
  • Structural Engineering (SE) license with ability to obtain California licensure (passed the 16-hour SE exam)
  • Proven capability with Revit (model and drawing review), RISA (analysis/design), and development of calculation templates, standards, and detail libraries.
  • Effective written and verbal communication abilities, including facilitating meetings, preparing executive-level narratives, and engaging clients and specialty consultants.


Our client prefers a Structural Project Manager to have:

  • NCEES Record (or ability to acquire quickly)
  • Blast design and/or coordination experience (UFC 3‑340‑02, ASCE 59) or direct work with blast consultants.
  • Experience with VA Technical Information Library (TIL) criteria and Federal acquisition environment (FAR/IDIQ task orders).
  • Working knowledge of RISAConnection, Tekla Tedds (or equivalent), RAM/ETABS/SAP for special cases.
  • Experience mentoring and developing PMs/PEs; establishing QA/QC checklists and BIM standards.


Your responsibilities as the Structural Project Manager will include:

  • Lead the development of structural construction drawings and specifications.
  • Manage project prioritization, scheduling, budgeting, and coordination across disciplines.
  • Apply advanced engineering principles, including blast-resistant and progressive collapse design for government and industrial clients.
  • Oversee and mentor a team of engineers, EITs, and designers.
  • Ensure project delivery aligns with client expectations, regulatory codes, and firm standards.
  • Coordinate closely with architects and other design professionals.
  • Conduct meetings with clients, governmental agencies, and internal teams.
  • Build and maintain strong client relationships and support business development through proposals and presentations.
  • Serve as the technical liaison, representing the firm on complex project matters.
  • Support nationwide projects with occasional travel (1–2 days per month).


About Our Client:

We are a fast-growing engineering and design firm providing civil and structural engineering, project management, and design services across federal, healthcare, municipal, education, hospitality, commercial, and transportation markets. Recognized on the 2025 Hot Firm List, we are licensed in 39 states and deliver innovative, precise solutions that help our clients achieve their project goals and shape the built environment.


As a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) and member of the Society of American Military Engineers (SAME), we prioritize diversity, inclusion, and professional growth. Our team offers talented professionals the opportunity to work on meaningful projects, advance their careers, and contribute to a culture where collaboration, innovation, and excellence drive everything we do.


Ready to Build the Future?

Join our client’s team and bring your skills to life on impactful projects across healthcare, education, government, and industrial markets. Apply today and be part of a collaborative, innovative, and family-first culture that shapes the built environment across the nation.


Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.


The application window will close in 30 days.

title: Sr Implementation Engineer
description_html:
Senior Implementation Engineer – Hybrid 

 

Are you ready to take your career to the next level in the world of IT? Do you have a passion for building and optimizing cutting-edge digital infrastructures? If so, we want YOU to join our client’s forward-thinking team as a Senior Implementation Engineer.

 

At Panurgy, we deliver comprehensive IT services to businesses across New Jersey, New York, and Charlotte. Since 2000, we’ve specialized in managed IT, cloud solutions, cybersecurity, and business continuity, ensuring our clients' systems are secure, efficient, and up to date. We offer tailored IT solutions to meet the diverse needs of businesses, providing round-the-clock support and expert guidance. Our goal is to keep your operations running smoothly while helping your business grow.

 

We are expanding our team with an experienced Implementation Engineer to handle field installation and support for network servers, SANs, data and voice infrastructure, virtualization, and security solutions. You'll configure and monitor security systems in our Network Operations Center, provide remote support, and deploy virtual servers within our cloud services (IaaS). You will also assist with solution design, project management, and participate in a rotating emergency on-call schedule.

 

You should possess strong troubleshooting skills, experience with LAN/WAN/security systems, and expertise in Microsoft Server and Desktop platforms, as well as VMware virtualization. Effective communication with clients and team members is essential. This role is based at our headquarters in Cedar Knolls, NJ, with travel to client sites in the New Jersey/New York metro area (using a company car) and remote work flexibility. Competitive compensation, career growth opportunities, and training are offered.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We believe in investing in our team members and providing opportunities for growth and development. An annual salary of $100,000 to $120,000 reflects their commitment to your success and is commensurate with their experience and certifications. Opportunities for career growth and continued professional development, training, and certifications. When you join our team, you'll enjoy:

  • Well-Being and Work-Life Balance: paid time off, holidays, and hybrid work opportunities
  • Comprehensive Health coverage: medical, dental, and vision benefits
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Professional Development: employer-paid continuing education, comprehensive ongoing training and certification assistance, and future growth opportunities within the company
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered

 

Additionally, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees, where they can learn, grow, and thrive within the company. We aim to provide a collaborative and creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to their processes, decisions, planning, and the overall culture.

 

To be successful, you should have:

  • 5+ years of MSP support experience with expertise in Windows Server (Active Directory, Group Policy, DFS).
  • Extensive hands-on experience with VMware, Hyper-V, Azure virtualization, and cloud-based platforms.
  • Proficient in networking, including installation, configuration, and support of firewalls, switches, and access points.
  • Experience managing MS 365 services (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams) and MS365 Endpoint Management (MDM, Intune).
  • MCSA or Microsoft 365 Associate certification, strong problem-solving, troubleshooting, and communication skills.

 

Our client prefers that top candidates have:

  • Experience with administering and supporting EMC Storage Area Networks (SAN).
  • Microsoft MCSE or advanced M365/Azure certifications strongly preferred.
  • Security+ certification preferred.
  • Experience with Cisco DUO and ConnectWise.
  • Familiarity with SonicWall Firewalls & SMAs, and VMware VCP/VCAP certifications.

 

What you’ll do as the Senior Implementation Engineer:

  • Provide Level 3 support for complex issues escalated by the help desk and junior engineers.
  • Implement, deploy, and manage cloud-based services (Azure, MS365) and network solutions.
  • Plan and oversee disaster recovery, backup solutions, and system security protocols.
  • Provide remote and on-site support for the installation, configuration, and maintenance of infrastructure, including servers, networks, firewalls, and other related components.
  • Collaborate on complex projects, offering design, implementation support, and mentoring junior engineers.

 

Who is Panuary?

For over two decades, Panuary has been a leading IT Managed Services Provider to mid-market companies throughout North America. We design, install, and support local and wide area data networks and VoIP communications systems, and provide 24x7 monitoring, administration, help desk, data protection, virtualization, Infrastructure as a Service hosting, business continuity/disaster recovery, and a robust suite of managed security services to our contract clients throughout North America.

 

We hold various authorizations and certifications, including Microsoft Silver Partner, VMware Enterprise Partner, Dell EMC Partner, SonicWALL SecureFirst Partner, and partnerships with HP, Avaya, CoreDial, among others.

 

Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you're ready to take your career to new heights and be part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of IT, we want to hear from you! Please apply now to join us on this exciting journey. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: SR HR Generalist
description_html:
Senior Human Resources (HR) Generalist

 

Are you a dynamic HR professional ready to make a significant impact? We're looking for a passionate Senior HR Generalist to join our client’s team and help shape the future of their workforce!

 

Our client values their employees’ time and efforts. Their commitment to your success is enhanced by their competitive compensation of $85k-95k annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package, including:

  • Comprehensive Insurance: Health, dental, vision, life, and disability coverage.
  • Financial Security: 401(k) with company match and incentive pay.
  • Time Off: 16 days PTO, paid holidays, and flexible spending account.
  • Growth & Development: Career advancement opportunities and professional development assistance.

 

Plus, they work to maintain the best environment for their employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. They strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to their processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

As a Sr. HR Generalist, you will provide exceptional service by thoroughly understanding the organization, personnel policies and practices, recruitment process, employee benefit programs, and employee relations programs. You will develop and execute recruitment strategies in support of organizational staffing objectives and administer employee benefits programs and the day-to-day activities of the Human Resources Department.

 

To be successful, you should have:

  • 7-10 years in a human resource generalist role with strong HR administrative experience.
  • Knowledge of employment laws, recruiting, onboarding, orientation, training, and compliance documentation.
  • Proficiency in MS Office, applicant tracking systems, and project management tools.
  • Solid communication, problem-solving abilities, and the capacity to build positive relationships.
  • Excellent time management, attention to detail, and managing multiple priorities effectively.

 

Your responsibilities as the Sr. HR Generalist will include:

  • Talent Strategy & Acquisition: Partner with leadership to execute HR strategies, including recruiting, retention, and succession planning, while managing the full employee life cycle.
  • HR Administration: Oversee HR processes from onboarding to offboarding, including job postings, compliance, benefits administration, and employee documentation.
  • Employee Relations: In collaboration with the PEO and HR specialists, provide guidance on complex HR issues, including accommodations, investigations, and terminations.
  • Employee Development & Engagement: To enhance culture and retention, champion learning, development programs, and employee recognition initiatives.
  • Compliance & Best Practices: Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations while staying informed on HR trends and best practices.


Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Social Worker
description_html:
Social Worker

 

New Ground

Location: Levittown, NY

 

Are you passionate about making a meaningful impact on individuals and families? Do you have the heart of a social worker and the drive to empower others to break free from the cycle of hardship? If so, we invite you to join our dedicated team as a Social Worker!

 

New Ground is a unique non-profit agency committed to helping Long Islanders break the cycle of homelessness and poverty for almost 35 years. We provide immediate assistance, resources, and long-term guidance and solutions to help clients build the skills to lead independent, successful lives. Our team approach utilizes specialists in social work, education, and other areas of expertise to provide the best services to those in need. 

 

As a full-time Social Worker, you will provide assessment, guidance, emotional support, counseling, and resources to Long Islanders in need. Weekly individual LCSW supervision is provided. 

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

New Ground values our employees’ time and efforts. A competitive compensation of $62-65k annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package highlight our commitment to your success. The benefits package includes: 

  • Comprehensive 100% employer-paid health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided at no cost to the employee 
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: 11 paid holidays and other paid time off opportunities 
  • New Ground is an approved NYS setting for licensed social work practice, with weekly LCSW supervision provided to meet licensure requirements for the LCSW. 

 

New Ground is an approved qualifying employer under the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF). Employees in this position may qualify for student loan forgiveness.

 

We also maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We provide ample professional growth and development opportunities within the field of Social Work. We strive to provide a collaborative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture. 

 

To succeed, you should have:

  • A MSW and LMSW, or plans to secure the LMSW within 12 months of the hire date 
  • Experience with homelessness, trauma, and/or substance abuse is a plus 
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills coupled with solid time management and organization skills 
  • Solid Internet experience and knowledge of Microsoft Office programs required 
  • Valid driver's license and access to a vehicle are required 
  • Bilingual English/Spanish speaking a plus

 

Your day-to-day responsibilities as the Social Worker will include:

  • Maintain regular, frequent contact with caseload, including office visits and offsite visits at various community locations weekly in addition to phone calls, emails, etc.
  • Provide clinically therapeutic assessments, insight, feedback, and interventions in areas of concern 
  • Advocate for all family members in areas of social services, education, and more 
  • Provide motivation, encouragement, and empowerment in areas necessary for clients to move toward achieving independence 
  • Assist caseload in drafting short and long-term goals and tracking progress in reaching these goals in a timely fashion 
  • Maintain strict documentation of all client contact, including monthly reviews of goals and progress, updating statistics, utilizing required agency forms, systems, and procedures 
  • Attend weekly meetings with the social work team for collaboration on cases, action plans 
  • and other program items
  • Investigate resources for programs as needed and refer clients to appropriate organizations, maintaining a high level of knowledge of community resources for the population served 
  • Collaborate with the Associate Program Director on education advocacy issues for children in the program alongside parents in school settings 
  • Work independently from various locations in Nassau and Suffolk County, as well as in the office
  • Provide support and assistance to colleagues and the agency overall as needed 

 

Together, we can build a brighter future for all.

If you're ready to be a catalyst for change and help break the cycle of homelessness and poverty, we want to hear from you! Join New Ground’s mission to create a more just and compassionate society, one life at a time. Apply now and be a part of something significant.


Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. Our client does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Your day-to-day responsibilities as the Social Worker will include:
Maintain regular, frequent contact with caseload, including office visits and offsite visits at various community locations weekly in addition to phone calls, emails, etc.
Provide clinically therapeutic assessments, insight, feedback, and interventions in areas of concern
Advocate for all family members in areas of social services, education, and more
Provide motivation, encouragement, and empowerment in areas necessary for clients to move toward achieving independence
Assist caseload in drafting short and long-term goals and tracking progress in reaching these goals in a timely fashion
Maintain strict documentation of all client contact, including monthly reviews of goals and progress, updating statistics, utilizing required agency forms, systems, and procedures
Attend weekly meetings with the social work team for collaboration on cases, action plans
and other program items
Investigate resources for programs as needed and refer clients to appropriate organizations, maintaining a high level of knowledge of community resources for the population served
Collaborate with the Associate Program Director on education advocacy issues for children in the program alongside parents in school settings
Work independently from various locations in Nassau and Suffolk County, as well as in the office
Provide support and assistance to colleagues and the agency overall as needed
Together, we can build a brighter future for all.
If you're ready to be a catalyst for change and help break the cycle of homelessness and poverty, we
want to hear from you! Join New Ground’s mission to create a more just and compassionate society, one
life at a time. Apply now and be a part of something significant.
Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. Our client does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior IBMi Consultant
description_html:
Senior IBM i Consultant

 

Are you a seasoned technical expert passionate about driving real business impact? At Guide Technologies, we’re seeking a Senior Consultant who thrives in a dynamic, customer-centric environment and is ready to advance their career in ERP consulting. You will serve as a trusted technical subject-matter expert supporting IBM i environments, Infor XA upgrades, and related customer implementations. By combining hands-on development, system administration, and upgrade management with customer-facing consulting, we offer the opportunity to solve complex challenges and deliver meaningful results for manufacturing clients. If you thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and enjoy blending deep technical expertise with real-world business impact, this role offers a chance to grow your career while making a difference.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

As a services provider, our team is our lifeblood, and we value your efforts. We support you with competitive compensation of $100K-$130K annually, depending on experience, a benefits package, and a growth path aligned with your career goals. The extensive benefits package includes:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance offered 
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with up to 3.5% employer matching available
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and remote work opportunities

 

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to their processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To thrive as our Senior Consultant, you should have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience;7+ years supporting IBM i environments and ERP applications, preferably Infor XA.
  • Demonstrated expertise in IBM i system administration, including command-line operations, ACS, IBM Navigator, system configuration, security concepts, and vendor application installations.
  • Advanced development skills in CLP, RPGLE, SQLRPGLE, with solid command of SQL tools (DFU, DBU, STRSQL, SQL Scripts) and data integration formats such as XML and JSON.
  • Experience with modern technologies such as Java, Python, and web-based integrations; familiarity with WebSphere and Microsoft Office tools.
  • Proven customer-facing consulting abilities, including clear written and verbal communication, and the capability to present and train small to mid-sized user groups.
  • Willingness to travel occasionally and accommodate flexible schedules, including evening or weekend work for go-live events, upgrades, PTFs, and deployments.

 

Your responsibilities as the Senior Consultant will include:

  • Own IBM i and Infor XA system administration, including OS patching, PCM and XA upgrades across multiple environments, security management, backups, and environment configuration.
  • Lead customer upgrade initiatives from planning through execution, serving as the PUI subject-matter expert, managing XA version transitions, AWS Corretto upgrades, and maintaining clear customer documentation.
  • Design and implement automation solutions to modernize and replace manual processes, particularly within cloud and upgrade workflows.
  • Monitor service contract activity, perform root-cause analysis, and deliver regular status updates and recommendations to internal teams and customers.
  • Serve as a technical and application consultant, partnering directly with customers to support implementations, upgrades, and ongoing system optimization.

 

About Us:

At Guide Technologies, we’ve spent nearly three decades guiding manufacturers through complex digital transformation with purpose and precision. As a top-performing Infor Gold Resell Partner and ERP consulting leader, we deliver industry-leading expertise in Infor solutions—from deep legacy environments like Infor XA to modern cloud-based platforms. Our team combines technical mastery, proven methodologies, and a collaborative spirit to help manufacturing and distribution companies optimize operations, accelerate growth, and unlock the full potential of their technology investments. We value innovation, continuous learning, and client success, and our consultants work hand in hand with customers to solve their toughest challenges with confidence and care.

 

Ignite your Career!

Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply now and join our client’s team of industry experts! 

 

We anticipate that the application window will close in 60 days.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description_html:
Senior Electrical Engineer

 

Ready to power up your career with a team that thrives on innovation and hands‑on engineering excellence? At Minot Enterprises, we’re searching for a seasoned Senior Electrical Engineer to lead the design, analysis, and specification of mission‑critical power distribution systems for complex industrial facilities. If you’re passionate about solving real‑world electrical challenges, especially around medium‑voltage equipment, protective relaying, and low‑voltage switchgear, and you bring deep NEC knowledge coupled with SKM Power*Tools expertise, this is your opportunity to make a measurable impact on projects that matter.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

At Minot Enterprises, we value your time, expertise, and growth. Our commitment to your success is reflected in a competitive salary of $140,000 - $145,600 annually, depending on experience, with a performance bonus and an extensive benefits package, including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work options

 

As a 100% employee-owned company, we foster a collaborative, creative environment where every voice matters. You’ll work on challenging, rewarding projects, have access to professional growth opportunities and continuing education, and contribute directly to our processes, planning, and culture. At Minot, your career and ideas have a meaningful impact every day.

 

To thrive as the Senior Electrical Engineer, you should have:        

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering with 5+ years of experience in power distribution and protection systems.
  • Expertise in medium-voltage distribution, protective relaying, and low-voltage switchgear applications.
  • Proficiency in SKM Power*Tools and thorough knowledge of NEC, IEEE standards, and industry practices.
  • Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred, or eligibility to obtain.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills, with flexibility to travel and lead technical discussions with clients and project teams.

 

Your responsibilities as the Senior Electrical Engineer will include:        

  • Lead the design, specification, and analysis of medium- and low-voltage power distribution systems, including switchgear, MCCs, and protective relays.
  • Perform system studies such as short-circuit, coordination, arc-flash, and load flow using SKM Power*Tools.
  • Develop detailed construction documents, one-line diagrams, equipment layouts, and procurement specifications.
  • Review vendor proposals and provide technical oversight during procurement, installation, and commissioning.
  • Ensure all designs comply with NEC, IEEE, and NFPA 70E standards while collaborating with project teams for safe and efficient solutions.

 

About Us

At Minot Enterprises, we’re more than just engineers; we’re innovators committed to delivering tailored automation and electrical solutions that keep industry moving. Founded in 2004, our team has grown into a highly collaborative group of professionals specializing in process electrical, control systems engineering, mechanical design, and data management services. With a broad portfolio of projects across diverse sectors, we combine technical rigor with a culture that values creativity, integrity, and teamwork. As a 100% employee-owned company, we empower every team member to shape the future of industrial engineering and grow with us as we solve tomorrow’s toughest challenges. 

 

Join Our Team and Power the Future

Bring your expertise, creativity, and drive to a 100% employee-owned company where challenging projects, growth opportunities, and top-tier benefits await. Your next career milestone starts here. Apply now and make a real impact on the industries that keep the world moving. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.
