title: Senior Banking Operations Officer
description_html:
Senior Banking Operations Officer

 

The MINT National Bank is seeking a Senior Banking Operations Officer. A Bank Senior Operations Officer for a National Bank is a hands-on high-level management professional responsible for the efficiency, security, and regulatory compliance of a financial institution's daily activities. They oversee and perform critical back-office functions—such as transaction processing, account management, compliance management, BSA/AML management, and internal auditing management, treasury management and enhancing workflows through technology and strategic planning, acting as a bridge between staff, clients, and executives to ensure smooth service delivery and risk mitigation.  Additionally, they would have purview of the operational functions of the lobby services area.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Daily Operational Management: Monitor and be able to perform the execution of daily tasks including but not limited to ACH, wires, lobby services, back-office deposit processing, debit cards, fraud research, garnishment/levies/subpoena request requirements, CD/IRA and online banking/cash management.  Ensuring adherence in compliance management and BSA/SML management.   Perform operational management of internal, external and regulatory audit functions.


  • Policy Development: Maintain, develop and implement strategies to enhance operational processes that will optimize resource utilization and streamline reporting while maintaining internal infrastructures, reporting systems, and company policies that foster growth and operational efficiency and meet regulatory requirements.

 

  • Regulatory Compliance & Risk: Manage the Compliance Function for the Bank to ensure all activities strictly adhere to federal and state banking regulations, anti-money laundering (AML) laws, and internal policy and security protocols.  Facilitate the training and development of Bank policies and federal regulations to mitigate risks.

 

  • Team Leadership: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide hands-on technical guidance to various departments, including bookkeeping, accounting, loan administration, and teller/lobby services groups to achieve organizational goals and deliver exceptional customer service.

 

  • Audit & Quality Control: Manage the internal, external and regulatory audit functions of the Bank.  Hands-on management of all operational, compliance and regulatory audits, including providing all audit request list documents.  Conduct regular reviews of documentation and data quality to ensure positive audit outcomes and error-free processing.  This includes data gathering information for OCC regulatory exams (compliance, BSA/AML, internal audit, general bank operations, etc.)

 

  • Strategic Planning: Collaborate with senior management to translate business goals into actionable operational plans and tactical budgets.

 

  • Vendor & Client Relations: Manage relationships with external vendors and resolve high-level client issues that require interdepartmental coordination.

 

Required Skills

 

  • Technical Proficiency: Hands-on advanced knowledge of complex financial instruments, payment processing functions (Treasury management functions, ACH, ewire, Fed payments systems, Positive Pay, Verafin BSA/AML software, etc), and FIS Horizon XE core banking system.

 

  • Compliance Expertise: Hands-on deep understanding of all aspects of National Bank compliance management, compliance risk management, fraud prevention, and regulatory frameworks (e.g., Bank Secrecy Act, AML, Patriot Act).

 

  • Analytical Thinking: Ability to use data to identify trends, create measurement tools for efficiency, and solve complex operational bottlenecks.

 

  • Communication: Excellent social, communication, and interpersonal skills.  Strong written and verbal skills for drafting policies, presenting to senior management, and negotiating with stakeholders.

 

  • Software Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel), FIS Horizon XE Core Software, Verafin BSA Software, etc. 

 

Qualifications & Experience

 

Experience: 10+ years of hands-on senior bank operations experience with a National Bank, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership managerial role required.  5 years national bank Compliance officer experience, BSA officer experience, and internal audit experience required.  

 

Specialized Knowledge: Bank Compliance Officer experience, BSA/AML Officer experience, Internal Audit Management experience required. 

 

Education: A bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics (or a related field), or an equivalent combination of education and 10+ years hands-on senior bank operations experience. Graduate degree in business, an MBA, or related professional certifications a plus.

 

Comprehensive Total Rewards Offering:

 

We offer a competitive total rewards package designed to attract, retain, and support high-performing professionals. The package includes:

  • Competitive salary, commensurate with experience
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401(k) plan with employer matching contributions
  • Life and disability insurance coverage
  • Health savings and flexible spending accounts
  • Paid time off

 

Beyond compensation, we emphasize a culture of collaboration, professional growth, and meaningful employee engagement.

 

About Us

 

The MINT National Bank is a community-focused financial institution built on the belief that banking should be personal, dependable, and forward-thinking. Established to serve local individuals and businesses with integrity and common-sense banking solutions, The MINT combines the strength and stability of a national bank with the customer-centric approach of a hometown partner. We’re FDIC-insured and committed to delivering exceptional services from commercial lending and treasury management to online and mobile banking backed by secure, modern technology. Our team strives to put customers first, keep solutions simple, and build trust in every interaction. With a culture rooted in community involvement and strategic innovation, The MINT continues to grow while keeping your success at the heart of everything we do.

 

The MINT National Bank

 

Step Into the Heart of Banking Excellence

If you’re a senior operations leader who thrives on precision, compliance, and transforming complex systems into seamless experiences, The MINT National Bank is where your expertise can genuinely make an impact — apply now and help shape the future of a modern national bank.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. 


#PRO

title: School Board Executive Administrator and Grant Coordinator - Indiana Statewide
description_html:
School Board Executive Administrator & Grant Coordinator

Hoosier College and Career Academy


 

Location: Remote (Indianapolis-based preferred)

Type: Full-Time
Salary: Negotiable based on experience
Benefits: Comprehensive benefits package included


About Hoosier College and Career Academy (HCCA)

Hoosier College and Career Academy (HCCA), operated by Hoosier Academy, Inc., is a virtual public charter school serving Indiana students in grades 7–12. Authorized by Ball State University, HCCA is committed to providing personalized, research-based virtual learning aligned with Indiana academic standards.  HCCA’s mission is to provide personalized, virtual learning opportunities to all Indiana students regardless of circumstances and abilities. Utilizing research-based virtual platforms, Indiana Department of Education aligned academic standards, and meaningful partnerships, HCCA aims to prepare today’s learners for tomorrow’s ever-changing career and academic opportunities.


Position Summary

The School Board Executive Administrator & Grants Coordinator serves as a vital link between the Board of Directors, school leadership, and external stakeholders. This role ensures smooth governance operations, regulatory compliance, and effective grant management. The ideal candidate is highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, virtual environment.


This is a primarily remote position, with periodic in-person attendance required at Board and committee meetings in Indianapolis.


Key Responsibilities

School Board Administration

  • Coordinate Board activities and maintain official records, policies, and resolutions.
  • Set meeting agendas in collaboration with the Board and Head of School.
  • Prepare and distribute Board packets and presentations.
  • Attend and facilitate Board and committee meetings, including technology setup.
  • Draft and post meeting minutes in compliance with charter requirements.
  • Assist with Board member recruitment, onboarding, and training coordination.
  • Support the Board in evaluating the Educational Service Provider (Stride K12, Inc.).
  • Manage Board responsibilities related to charter renewal processes.


Compliance Coordination

  • Ensure adherence to Indiana Open Door Law, Access to Public Records Act, and other regulatory requirements.
  • Coordinate with Stride staff and legal counsel on compliance with bylaws, fiscal policies, and corrective action plans.
  • Serve as the Board’s liaison to the Authorizer and attend required training sessions.
  • Support hiring processes for local staff and participate in interviews.


Grant Writing & Title Program Oversight

  • Research and identify grant opportunities aligned with HCCA’s mission.
  • Write and submit compelling grant proposals, applications, and reports.
  • Maintain a grant calendar and ensure timely submissions.
  • Facilitate all Title correspondence and ensure compliance with federal program requirements.


Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in regulatory compliance, grant writing, or education administration.
  • Familiarity with virtual school models and Indiana education systems.
  • Strong communication skills—both written and verbal.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint) and Zoom.
  • Ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Experience in human resources or board governance (preferred).


Why Join HCCA?

  • Flexible remote work environment
  • Supportive, mission-driven team
  • Opportunities for professional growth
  • Make a meaningful impact on students across Indiana

 

To Apply for This Position:

Please follow this link into the Indiana Department of Education career site Nimble to create your profile, upload your resume and any other documents that you wish to have considered, and apply directly for this position: https://app.hirenimble.com/jobview/93477. 


Hoosier Academy, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. description_text:
School Board Executive Administrator & Grant Coordinator
Hoosier College and Career Academy
Location:
Remote (Indianapolis-based preferred)
Type:
Full-Time
Salary:
Negotiable based on experience
Benefits:
Comprehensive benefits package included
About Hoosier College and Career Academy (HCCA)
Hoosier College and Career Academy (HCCA), operated by Hoosier Academy, Inc., is a virtual public charter school serving Indiana students in grades 7–12. Authorized by Ball State University, HCCA is committed to providing personalized, research-based virtual learning aligned with Indiana academic standards.  HCCA’s mission is to provide personalized, virtual learning opportunities to all Indiana students regardless of circumstances and abilities. Utilizing research-based virtual platforms, Indiana Department of Education aligned academic standards, and meaningful partnerships, HCCA aims to prepare today’s learners for tomorrow’s ever-changing career and academic opportunities.
Position Summary
The School Board Executive Administrator & Grants Coordinator serves as a vital link between the Board of Directors, school leadership, and external stakeholders. This role ensures smooth governance operations, regulatory compliance, and effective grant management. The ideal candidate is highly organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced, virtual environment.
This is a primarily remote position, with periodic in-person attendance required at Board and committee meetings in Indianapolis.
Key Responsibilities
School Board Administration
Coordinate Board activities and maintain official records, policies, and resolutions.
Set meeting agendas in collaboration with the Board and Head of School.
Prepare and distribute Board packets and presentations.
Attend and facilitate Board and committee meetings, including technology setup.
Draft and post meeting minutes in compliance with charter requirements.
Assist with Board member recruitment, onboarding, and training coordination.
Support the Board in evaluating the Educational Service Provider (Stride K12, Inc.).
Manage Board responsibilities related to charter renewal processes.
Compliance Coordination
Ensure adherence to Indiana Open Door Law, Access to Public Records Act, and other regulatory requirements.
Coordinate with Stride staff and legal counsel on compliance with bylaws, fiscal policies, and corrective action plans.
Serve as the Board’s liaison to the Authorizer and attend required training sessions.
Support hiring processes for local staff and participate in interviews.
Grant Writing & Title Program Oversight
Research and identify grant opportunities aligned with HCCA’s mission.
Write and submit compelling grant proposals, applications, and reports.
Maintain a grant calendar and ensure timely submissions.
Facilitate all Title correspondence and ensure compliance with federal program requirements.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in regulatory compliance, grant writing, or education administration.
Familiarity with virtual school models and Indiana education systems.
Strong communication skills—both written and verbal.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint) and Zoom.
Ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
Strong time management and organizational skills.
Experience in human resources or board governance (preferred).
Why Join HCCA?
Flexible remote work environment
Supportive, mission-driven team
Opportunities for professional growth
Make a meaningful impact on students across Indiana

Please follow this link into the Indiana Department of Education career site Nimble to create your profile, upload your resume and any other documents that you wish to have considered, and apply directly for this position:
https://app.hirenimble.com/jobview/93477

title: Sanitation Technician I
description_html:
Sanitation Technician I

For 50 years, Biotics Research Corporation has been at the forefront of the nutrition industry, renowned for our top-quality supplements and innovative product delivery systems. Our commitment to advancement is driven by our focus on research initiatives, unique product formulations, and unparalleled quality control. As a family-owned company with a rich history, we take pride in our valued partnerships with healthcare professionals, ensuring that our products meet the highest standards of excellence.

This position is responsible for maintaining cleanliness and sanitation standards in warehouses and food processing areas in accordance with FDA regulatory requirements and company policies.


Essential responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Perform general cleaning tasks (sweeping, mopping, trash disposal).
  • Operate cleaning machines and equipment safely.
  • Clean and sanitize food processing equipment and facilities.
  • Handle water hoses and chemical solutions safely.
  • Complete sanitation logs and documentation.
  • Maintain hand-wash and sanitizing stations.
  • Work in environments with extreme temperatures and wet conditions.
  • Adhere to GMP and safety training requirements.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Work Requirements and Skills

  • Previous experience preferred but not required.
  • Ability to read, write, and communicate in English.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and work in a wet environment.
  • Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
  • Flexibility for overtime as needed.

Benefits

  • 401(k) with company contribution
  • Incentive pay
  • 16 days PTO plus holidays
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Life and disability coverage
  • Professional development assistance
  • Flexible spending account
  • Referral program
  • Career growth path
  • In-house product allowance



We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Sales Engineer
description_html:
Sales Engineer

 

As a Sales Engineer with B/T Western, you will support Account Managers by providing technical sales expertise across OEM accounts, collaborating with multiple customer departments, and influencing key decision-makers. You will develop deep knowledge of supplier products and capabilities, build strong supplier relationships, and clearly communicate technical solutions to customers and internal teams. Additionally, you will support product development by guiding suppliers through customer processes, anticipating challenges, and helping deliver optimal, market-ready solutions aligned with business objectives.

 

What We Offer You: 

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation of $110,000-$135,000 annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package, including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical and dental insurance are provided.
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching.
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection.
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts are offered.
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work choices are provided.

 

Plus, we work hard to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, fostering a space where everyone can learn and grow alongside the company. We strive to create a collaborative atmosphere where all team members feel empowered to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

You Should Have: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Industrial Technology, or a related technical discipline preferred; extensive automotive industry experience may substitute.
  • 3–5 years of relevant experience in the automotive industry, supporting technical sales, engineering, or product development activities.
  • Proven technical aptitude with engineered automotive products and the ability to translate technical requirements into practical solutions.
  • Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite and Microsoft Project; working knowledge of CAD software preferred.
  • Valid driver’s license with access to a personal vehicle and the ability to travel as required.

 

As The Sales Engineer, You Will Be Responsible For:

  • Support Account Managers by presenting suppliers and products, contributing to strategic selling efforts, and helping achieve targeted sales goals.
  • Build and maintain effective relationships with key customer decision-makers and supplier contacts across assigned accounts.
  • Maintain comprehensive knowledge of supplier products, production processes, customer programs, and competitive positioning.
  • Support product development activities by coordinating supplier and customer communication, managing timelines, reviewing PPAP documentation, and assisting with product validation and launch.
  • Manage required reporting, travel, audits, and administrative duties while meeting time and budget constraints.

 

Who We Are: 

B/T Western is a premier full-service manufacturer’s representative in the automotive Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) market. Our customers include Toyota, Nissan, Honda, Hyundai, KIA, Subaru, BMW, Mercedes, GM, Ford, FCA, and other global brands.

 

For over 40 years, we have built exceptional relationships with suppliers and Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs). We pride ourselves on extraordinary sales performance, new product development, marketing, program management, and building long-term strategic relations within the auto industry.

 

Ready to Engineer the Future of Automotive Accessories?

If you thrive at the intersection of technology, collaboration, and innovation, this is your chance to influence OEM programs, shape product solutions, and accelerate your career. Apply now and help drive cutting-edge ideas from concept to the road.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Registered Nurse
description_html:
Registered Nurse– Oncology 

 

Are you a compassionate and driven individual with a passion for helping others? Do you want to be part of a dynamic team at the forefront of cancer treatment and research? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! 

 

The Berenson Cancer Center is led by world-renowned oncologist and researcher James R. Berenson, MD, a pioneer in developing cutting-edge therapies for patients with myeloma and related blood cancers. We're seeking a skilled Registered Nurse to join our team and play a vital role in supporting our healthcare professionals as we work to improve our patients' lives. Our office is located in the Sunset Medical Tower in West Hollywood, California, near Beverly Hills. 

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:  

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation of $49-$59 per hour, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Health benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401(k) retirement plan with employer matching
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health savings account
  • Paid time off and holidays
  • Flexible schedule
  • Employee assistance program
  • Professional development assistance

 

Plus, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees, where they can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

As a detail-oriented Oncology RN, you should have:

  • RN degree 
  • Current CA licensure
  • 2+ years of training in Oncology Nursing that includes central line/IV and BLS certification

 

Your responsibilities as the Oncology Nurse will include:

 

Nursing  

  • Provide direct patient care and supervise patient care provided by other nurses
  • Start IVs
  • Administer treatments
  • Vital signs as needed
  • Ensure all nursing staff properly communicate lab results to the M.D.
  • Ensure all nursing staff provide the required interventions necessary for abnormal lab results and other clinical problems.
  • Coordinate with Cedars-Sinai for blood or platelet transfusions via email and entering orders on Cedars’ EPIC system.
  • Ensure all nursing staff provide outpatient prescriptions in a timely fashion for patients.
  • Ensure all nursing staff know which medications have REMS programs and enroll patients in such programs.
  • Provide direction and give instructions during an emergent situation

 

Lab

  • Assure that transfer of blood, urine, and bone marrow specimens occurs in a timely and accurate fashion to the designated recipient

 

Research

  • Oversee clinical trials-related work that is performed in the clinic
  • Train all clinical staff on clinical trial procedures during onboarding and as needed
  • Comprehensive review of new clinical trials and protocols, including feasibility assessment of clinic participation and identification/editing of protocol deficiencies.
  • Determination with Clinical Research Data Lead of staff, equipment, and supply needs to complete tasks required for the studies
  • Proper conduct of trials by clinical staff (nursing, pharmacy, lab, and physicians)

 

Ready to make a difference in the lives of our patients? 

Join us in our mission to provide exceptional care, support, and hope to individuals facing the challenges of cancer. Together, we can make a difference! 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. 

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment, in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance Processor
description_html:
Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance Processor


$21.50 - $23.50 Hourly DOE

 

Liberty Insurance seeks a Personal Lines Insurance Processor to manage all aspects of new and renewal personal insurance business while delivering exceptional customer service. You will maintain accurate recordkeeping of all policy information, quote and write new business, and support the retention of the existing book of business. In this role, you will ensure clients’ insurance needs are handled with accuracy and care, helping protect what matters most to them.

 

Liberty Insurance’s Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture: 

We value every member of our team, which is why we offer competitive pay and an extensive benefits package, including:

  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
  • Solid Work/Life Balance, including PTO and paid holidays
  • Financial wellness, including an FSA, 401K and match
  • Educational Reimbursement
  • Family assistance, including Adoption Assistance, EAP/Health and Welfare Assistance
  • Growth opportunities, including Leadership Development
  • Substantial perks, including Online Marketplace* discounts on a variety of goods and services, ERG/ Ambassador Group 
  • Free and reduced-rate bank services 

 

To thrive as the Personal Lines Insurance Processor, you should have:

  • Associate degree or equivalent education, or one to three years of related experience/training in sales, insurance, or customer service.
  • Active Property & Casualty Agent’s license with commitment to maintaining continuing education requirements.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office with applied knowledge of TAMS Policy Management System and insurance quoting websites preferred.
  • Ability to travel, as needed, to support client relationships, sales initiatives, or business requirements.

 

Your responsibilities as the Personal Lines Insurance Processor will include:

  • Review daily carrier reports, monitor policy status, and resolve discrepancies to ensure continuous and accurate coverage.
  • Serve as the primary liaison with clients, mortgage companies, and carriers to coordinate documents, payments, and policy updates.
  • Prepare and send renewal quotes and invoices, process client payments, and maintain accurate bookkeeping records.
  • Assist clients with coverage options, basic claims inquiries, and quote comparisons while providing responsive customer service.
  • Maintain organized records, support office operations, and contribute to process improvements and team initiatives

 

Liberty Insurance is an Independent Insurance Agency committed to the principles of integrity, reliability, and exceptional customer service. Our goal is to provide our clients with the highest quality of service while providing innovative and comprehensive insurance solutions. We strive to make Liberty Insurance an incredible place to work and build a career. We want you to learn, grow, and share in the success you help create. 

 

We want to hear if you are ready to take the next step in your career and make a significant impact! 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Program Operations Associate
description_html:
Program Operations Associate

 

Are you looking for a career where you can grow, learn, and make a meaningful impact? At Prosperity Advisors, we’re looking for a Program Operations Associate to help drive firm-wide initiatives that enhance our efficiency, scalability, and growth. This role offers hands-on experience across project management, technology, and analytics in a dynamic, supportive environment. If you’re organized, adaptable, and eager to build a broad skill set while contributing to meaningful projects, this is your opportunity to join a team that values your development and success.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success in our ensemble practice is enhanced by providing a competitive salary of $60,000 to $67,000 annually, and an extensive benefits package, including: 

  • Group Health Insurance
  • Long-Term and Short-Term Disability Insurance
  • 401K with Employer Matching
  • Dental/Vision Insurance
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Parental Leave
  • PTO that includes PTO for Volunteer Work
  • Dependent Care for Flexible Spending Account
  • Flextime Policy

 

At Prosperity Advisors, you’ll have the chance to make a measurable difference in thousands of households—and help shape financial well-being for generations. We value our team members and their families and believe in supporting healthy, balanced, and financially confident lives.

 

To succeed, you should have:

Required

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Finance, Operations, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
  • 2–5 years of experience in project coordination, operations, IT support, or a related role
  • Proficiency with Microsoft 365 (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with collaboration tools such as SharePoint or Teams
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to analyze and present data effectively
  • Strong attention to detail, adaptability, and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, regulated environment

Preferred

  • Experience in the financial services industry
  • Familiarity with CRM, portfolio management, or financial systems
  • Experience with project management tools (e.g., Smartsheet, Planner, or similar)
  • Basic understanding of data analysis concepts, reporting, or dashboards (Excel, Power BI, etc.)

 

Your responsibilities as a Program Operations Associate will include:

  • Assist leaders with planning, tracking, and coordinating projects, timelines, and deliverables across stakeholders.
  • Maintain project records, status updates, dashboards, and reports to support decision-making.
  • Act as liaison for tech requests, support troubleshooting, system implementations, and user adoption.
  • Collect, validate, and analyze data, identify trends or gaps, and support data quality initiatives.
  • Help develop templates, standards, and internal communications, and contribute to firm-wide initiatives.

 

About Us 

Founded in 1989, Prosperity Advisors is a full-service financial planning team committed to helping clients pursue their life goals with confidence. Serving over 5,000 client households, we guide individuals and families at every stage of life—from first-time investors to seasoned wealth builders. Our approach combines personalized financial strategies with deep expertise, ensuring each client feels supported, informed, and empowered on their journey to economic well-being.

 

The Prosperity Network of Advisors extends this commitment to over 160 financial professionals nationwide. As an OSJ branch, we provide comprehensive support, compliance oversight, and business resources that empower our members to thrive. From training and education to succession planning, growth opportunities, and networking, our organization fosters collaboration and innovation, creating a vibrant community where knowledge and experience flow freely. With 300+ associated members, the network is a hub for mentorship, professional development, and long-term success.

 

Ready to take the next step in your career journey? 

If you are prepared to embark on an exciting journey in the finance industry, join us in delivering unparalleled service and shaping the future of financial solutions! 

 

We are an equal-opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. description_text:
Program Operations Associate
Are you looking for a career where you can grow, learn, and make a meaningful impact? At
Prosperity Advisors
, we’re looking for a
Program Operations Associate
to help drive firm-wide initiatives that enhance our efficiency, scalability, and growth. This role offers hands-on experience across project management, technology, and analytics in a dynamic, supportive environment. If you’re organized, adaptable, and eager to build a broad skill set while contributing to meaningful projects, this is your opportunity to join a team that values your development and success.
Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:
We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success in our ensemble practice is enhanced by providing a competitive salary of $60,000 to $67,000 annually, and an extensive benefits package, including:
Group Health Insurance
Long-Term and Short-Term Disability Insurance
401K with Employer Matching
Dental/Vision Insurance
Tuition Reimbursement
Parental Leave
PTO that includes PTO for Volunteer Work
Dependent Care for Flexible Spending Account
Flextime Policy
At Prosperity Advisors, you’ll have the chance to make a measurable difference in thousands of households—and help shape financial well-being for generations. We value our team members and their families and believe in supporting healthy, balanced, and financially confident lives.
To succeed, you should have:
Required
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Finance, Operations, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
2–5 years of experience in project coordination, operations, IT support, or a related role
Proficiency with Microsoft 365 (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with collaboration tools such as SharePoint or Teams
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to analyze and present data effectively
Strong attention to detail, adaptability, and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, regulated environment
Preferred
Experience in the financial services industry
Familiarity with CRM, portfolio management, or financial systems
Experience with project management tools (e.g., Smartsheet, Planner, or similar)
Basic understanding of data analysis concepts, reporting, or dashboards (Excel, Power BI, etc.)
Your responsibilities as a Program Operations Associate
will include:
Assist leaders with planning, tracking, and coordinating projects, timelines, and deliverables across stakeholders.
Maintain project records, status updates, dashboards, and reports to support decision-making.
Act as liaison for tech requests, support troubleshooting, system implementations, and user adoption.
Collect, validate, and analyze data, identify trends or gaps, and support data quality initiatives.
Help develop templates, standards, and internal communications, and contribute to firm-wide initiatives.
About Us
Founded in 1989,
Prosperity Advisors
is a full-service financial planning team committed to helping clients pursue their life goals with confidence. Serving over 5,000 client households, we guide individuals and families at every stage of life—from first-time investors to seasoned wealth builders. Our approach combines personalized financial strategies with deep expertise, ensuring each client feels supported, informed, and empowered on their journey to economic well-being.
The
Prosperity Network of Advisors
extends this commitment to over 160 financial professionals nationwide. As an OSJ branch, we provide comprehensive support, compliance oversight, and business resources that empower our members to thrive. From training and education to succession planning, growth opportunities, and networking, our organization fosters collaboration and innovation, creating a vibrant community where knowledge and experience flow freely. With 300+ associated members, the network is a hub for mentorship, professional development, and long-term success.
Ready to take the next step in your career journey?
If you are prepared to embark on an exciting journey in the finance industry, join us in delivering unparalleled service and shaping the future of financial solutions!

title: Patient Navigator
description_html:
Patient Navigator (Appointment Setting)

 

Thrifty Management Services is the dedicated MSO for Preferred IPA of California, providing the best possible care management, care coordination, and claims processing services to Preferred IPA and their members. We work with the network’s participating physicians to coordinate patient care when a referral is made to a specialist or hospital for diagnosis and treatment.  We coordinate patient care across all aspects of the provider network. We provide high quality services to its participating physicians and superior health care to its members.

 

Join one of the most trusted names in community healthcare! You’ll be part of a dedicated team connecting patients with the care they deserve. As a Patient Navigator (Appointment Scheduling) you will conduct phone and telehealth calls to engage members, coordinate with provider offices to complete preventive screenings, and document all outreach activities in our tracking systems. This role plays a crucial part in enhancing patient experiences, promoting preventive care compliance, and supporting the overall health of our community.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

We value the time and efforts of our employees and are committed to supporting your success. Our full-time Patient Navigator role offers competitive pay of $23 to $26 per hour, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package, including:

  • Flexible schedule: Hybrid schedule, Monday–Friday (computer not provided)
  • Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage to keep you and your family protected
  • Retirement planning: Access to a retirement plan to secure your future
  • Paid holidays: Most major holidays observed
  • Convenience perks: Free parking for in-office days
  • Professional growth: Educational assistance program to advance your skills
  • Performance rewards: Employee incentive program to recognize your contributions

 

We foster a people-centric culture that values collaboration, work-life balance, and enthusiasm for helping others. At Preferred IPA, you will thrive in an environment where your efforts are appreciated, your voice is heard, and your growth is encouraged.

 

To thrive as a Patient Navigator, you should have:        

  • High School Graduate or equivalent required
  • Minimum of three (3) years of customer service experience in an outbound-calling call center environment or Member Services/community outreach capacity at a managed care organization
  • Familiarity with managed care, Medi-Cal, Medicare, commercial is preferred
  • HEDIS experience preferred
  • Able to interface with customers both internal and external of Preferred IPA of CA
  • Bilingual – Fluent spoken Spanish/English required

 

As the Patient Navigator, you will be responsible for the following:

  • Conduct outbound calls to members which include educational or compliance-related calls, scheduling office visits, assistance with Annual Wellness Exams, Medication Adherence, etc.
  • Receive incoming calls through phone queues involving multiple issues from Members, Primary Care Physicians, and Health Plans. 
  • Ensure all patient interactions are documented in the Member Services Database (MSD) and run reports as may be necessary or required.
  • Maintain or exceed quality and productivity standards of a minimum of 65 calls per day with matching documentation.
  • Display professionalism, warm and pleasant phone personality, emphasizing tact, empathy, good judgment, and patience.
  • Additional duties as directed by management.

 

Join Our Mission!

Be the voice that connects patients to better health! If you’re passionate about helping others, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and want to make a real difference in community wellness, we’d love to have you on our team at Preferred IPA of California! 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Patient Care Coordinator/Medical Assistant, Front Office and Medical Assistant, Back Office - Prescott Office
description_html:
Arizona Kidney Disease and Hypertension Center (AKDHC) is one of the nation's largest groups of physicians specializing in the care of patients with renal disease. Since 1976, we have enjoyed the trust of patients and the respect of the community throughout the Phoenix Metropolitan area and across Arizona. We are a professional medical association consisting of physicians and other vital support staff. We are seeking Patient Care Coordinator/Medical Assistants to join our team. To learn more about us, please visit our website: www.akdhc.com.  


  

Medical Assistant, Back Office and Patient Care Coordinator/Medical Assistant, Front Office Positions - Prescott Office



Under the direction of the Office Coordinator, the Medical Assistant, Back Office and the Patient Care Coordinator/Medical Assistant, Front Office will be responsible for performing general medical assistant functions in support of the care and treatment of patients while providing assistance to all office personnel as needed. 
 
Responsibilities:

  • Perform patient care activities, such as back-office check-in, check-out, prescription refills, anemia, and iron management, administer injections, schedule procedures and provide patient education.
  • Schedule and process 24-hour blood pressure monitoring.
  • Interview patients, measure vital signs, such as pulse rate, temperature, blood pressure, weight, height; and update medication list; record information in patients’ charts/EMR to include urine tests per Clinitek.
  • Notify physician of changes in patient’s clinical status and/or abnormal test results.
  • Collect urine samples and process specimens for courier transport.
  • Monitor and optimize allotted time slots in all schedules utilizing the available programs/reports.
  • Complete clerical tasks including but not limited to distributing mail and reports, filing, scanning, scheduling, data input, answering phones and general support to all office personnel.
  • Adhere to company policies and procedures and prioritize and complete day to day activities.
  • Maintain office equipment, office, and medical supplies through efficient inventory management.
  • Process Hospital Disposition Reports.
  • Process Recall Reports and mail recall and no-show letters to patients; follow up with patients and/or primary care physicians as needed.
  • Monitor dictation process by maintaining accurate dictation logs, ensuring physician review and signature, mailing report and scanning dictation into patient files.
  • Process medical record requests for patients, referring physician offices and attorneys by adhering to HIPAA regulations to ensure HPI.
  • Assist in the annual purging process of patient charts.
  • May be required to report to alternate AKDHC worksites, as directed.

 

Qualifications:

  • Current certification as a Medical Assistant preferred or a diploma or certificate from a recognized course of study for preparing Medical Assistants preferred
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills for interfacing with patients, staff and outside vendors
  • 1-2 years front/back office experience preferred
  • Ability to support a pleasant, positive and cooperative teamwork environment
  • Successful candidate must be able to use a stethoscope, computer, scanner, printer, telephone, fax and copier.
  • Ability to multi-task and lift and/or move 50 pounds essential.


Benefits:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.


We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Parts Finisher/Polisher
description_html:
Parts Finisher - Metalworking 

Monday through Friday, 7:00 AM – 3:30 PM


If you have a keen eye for detail and a passion for precision metalworking, this is your chance to become an important part of our client’s team as a Parts Finishing - Metalworking Specialist!


Do you have a sharp eye for detail and take pride in turning good parts into great ones? At B&M Machine Co., Inc., we’re looking for a Metalworking Parts Finisher who enjoys hands-on work and understands that quality matters. In this role, you’ll be responsible for a variety of parts finishing operations in our machine shop, including manual sanding, polishing, deburring, and operating vibratory finishing equipment to ensure every part meets our high standards before it goes out the door. This is a full-time position, Monday through Friday, from 7:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m., ideal for someone with strong hand skills who is comfortable performing repetitive tasks independently while also contributing to the team.


Join us for the best-in-class benefits and perks:

We value the time and efforts of our employees. Our competitive compensation, ranging from $23 to $25 per hour depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package, further enhance our commitment to your success. Our benefits package includes:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance


Additionally, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees, where they can learn, grow, and thrive within the company. We strive to create a collaborative and creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.


To thrive, you should have:

  • Prior experience in parts finishing, manufacturing, or a technical production environment.
  • Demonstrated manual dexterity with sanding, polishing, deburring, and the ability to identify acceptable surface finishes and visual defects.
  • Working knowledge of finishing equipment, including sanding belts, hand pressure techniques, vibratory finishing machines, and basic equipment upkeep.
  • Consistent adherence to safety practices, including proper PPE use (such as N95 masks), safe lifting up to 50lbs, and respect for company policies and property.
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions, complete production paperwork, accept corrective feedback, and prevent repeat errors with minimal supervision.
  • Reliable attendance, professional conduct with coworkers and supervisors, and the capacity to work independently or collaboratively in a repetitive, high-volume setting.


Your responsibilities as the Parts Finisher will include:

  • Perform sanding, polishing, deburring, and other finishing operations on metal parts.
  • Operate vibratory finishing machines in addition to manual sanding equipment; ensure proper setup, monitoring, and shutdown procedures are followed.
  • Conduct first article and in-process inspections.
  • Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work environment.
  • Identify and correct quality issues proactively.

About Us:

Established in 1947, B&M Machine Co., Inc. is a family-owned precision machine shop with over 75 years of proven expertise. Based in Belleville, NJ, our 10,000-square-foot, air-conditioned facility specializes in custom jobbing, particularly machining brass, aluminum, and stainless steel. We proudly serve a diverse range of industries, including aerospace, medical, chemical, and custom architectural hardware, by delivering exceptional machining solutions tailored to each client’s unique specifications.


Our Equipment:

  • CNC Vertical Mills Haas/Brother + 4th/5th axis
  • Mazak Lathes w/ Bar Feeders
  • Mastercam CAD/CAM
  • Standard grinding, finishing, saw, and manual machining equipment.


Join our team and be part of a company that values craftsmanship, precision, and long-term client relationships!


Ready to take the next step in your career? 

Join our client on their mission to redefine precision manufacturing! Apply now and become a vital part of our team.

 

Our client is an equal-opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Conduct first article and in-process inspections.
Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work environment.
Identify and correct quality issues proactively.
About Us:
Established in 1947,
B&M Machine Co., Inc.
is a family-owned precision machine shop with over 75 years of proven expertise. Based in Belleville, NJ, our 10,000-square-foot, air-conditioned facility specializes in custom jobbing, particularly machining brass, aluminum, and stainless steel. We proudly serve a diverse range of industries, including aerospace, medical, chemical, and custom architectural hardware, by delivering exceptional machining solutions tailored to each client’s unique specifications.
Our Equipment:
CNC Vertical Mills Haas/Brother + 4th/5th axis
Mazak Lathes w/ Bar Feeders
Mastercam CAD/CAM
Standard grinding, finishing, saw, and manual machining equipment.
Join our team and be part of a company that values craftsmanship, precision, and long-term client relationships!
Ready to take the next step in your career?
Join our
client
on their mission to redefine precision manufacturing! Apply now and become a vital part of our team.
Our client is an
equal-opportunity
employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Packaging Technician
description_html:
Packaging Technician I

For 50 years, Biotics Research Corporation ha been at the forefront of the nutrition industry, renowned for our top-quality supplements and innovative product delivery systems. Our commitment to advancement is driven by our focus on research initiatives, unique product formulations, and unparalleled quality control. As a family-owned company with a rich history, we take pride in our valued partnerships with healthcare professionals, ensuring that our products meet the highest standards of excellence.

This position is responsible for ensuring products are packaged in accordance with FDA regulatory requirements as well as company procedures and policies.

Essential responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Package products to BRC quality standards and GMP regulations.
  • Assemble and operate packaging equipment correctly.
  • Monitor product quality during packaging runs.
  • Perform minor equipment troubleshooting and cleaning.
  • Maintain packaging rooms and equipment per cGMP standards.
  • Complete manufacturing/packaging records accurately.
  • Move packaged products to staging areas.
  • Maintain a safe, clean, and organized work environment.
  • Observe all GMP, Safety, and company policies.

Work Requirements and Skills

  • Previous experience preferred but not required.
  • Ability to read, write, and communicate in English.
  • Must complete BRC training program.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Flexibility for overtime as needed.

Benefits

  • 401(k) with company contribution
  • Incentive pay
  • 16 days PTO plus holidays
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Life and disability coverage
  • Professional development assistance
  • Flexible spending account
  • Referral program
  • Career growth path
  • In-house product allowance


We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Operations Supervisor
description_html:
Operations Supervisor

 

Are you a dynamic leader ready to take on a thrilling challenge in operations? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where every day is different? If so, we want YOU to be our next Operations Supervisor!

 

The Nelson Company seeks a reliable Operations Supervisor to lead a team, ensure seamless day-to-day operations, implement efficient processes, and drive continuous improvement, while fostering a positive and inclusive team culture.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation of $20-$22 per hour, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, holidays, and a flexible schedule

 

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To thrive as the Operations Supervisor, you should have:

  • At least 2+ years of proven work experience as Operations Supervisor, Manager, or similar role
  • Knowledge of organizational effectiveness and operations management
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Leadership ability
  • Outstanding organizational skills
  • Experience operating a forklift
  • Experience using Microsoft Office Suite

 

Your responsibilities will include the following:

  • Ensure all operations are carried out in an appropriate, cost-effective way
  • Improve operational management systems, processes, and best practices
  • Purchase materials, plan inventory, and oversee warehouse efficiency
  • Formulate strategic and operational objectives
  • Perform quality controls and monitor production KPIs
  • Recruit, train, and supervise staff
  • Find ways to increase the quality of customer service

 

About Us:

The Nelson Company distributes plastic and wood pallets, containers, racks, unitizing systems, and protective angleboard systems. We manufacture wooden and corrugated industrial packaging products, including custom pallets and containers.

 

Simply put, our people are real. Dedicated and hardworking. Our team thrives on solving complex packaging issues. You can count on us to be around for the long haul. If you are ready to join the team, apply today! 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Operations Manager
description_html:
Operations Manager


B&M Machine Co., a family-owned shop renowned for craftsmanship and precision, is seeking a dynamic 

Operations Manager to drive excellence on our shop floor. If you have hands-on CNC experience, a 

passion for optimizing operations, and the leadership skills to inspire a skilled team, this is your chance to 

make a tangible impact on a growing, trusted business.


Join us for the best-in-class benefits and perks:

We value the time and efforts of our employees. Our competitive compensation, ranging from $70,000 to 

$135,000 annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package, further enhance our

commitment to your success. Our benefits package includes: 


• Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided

• Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching

• Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection

• Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered

• Well-being and work-life balance


Additionally, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees in which they can learn, grow, 

and thrive within the company. We strive to create a collaborative and creative environment where 

everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.


To thrive, you should have:

• 5+ years of experience in CNC machining, fabrication, or related manufacturing field

• Proven leadership experience in a production or operations management role

• Familiarity with Lean Manufacturing and continuous improvement practices

• Engineering or technical college degree preferred

• Strong communication and organizational skills

• Ability to work independently and make decisions confidently

Your responsibilities as the Operations Manager will include:

• Lead and supervise production floor personnel in collaboration with the foreman

• Develop and implement metrics, policies, and procedures to meet company goals

• Ensure customer satisfaction through quality, cost control, and on-time delivery

• Manage estimating, quoting, and purchasing processes

• Oversee scheduling, work order release, and production flow

• Maintain equipment and facilities; ensure compliance with EHS standards

• Serve as primary point-of-contact for customer communications and contracts

• Support employee development, morale, and safety initiatives


About Us:

Established in 1947, B&M Machine Co., Inc. is a family-owned precision machine shop with over 75 years 

of proven expertise. Based in Belleville, NJ, our 10,000-square-foot, air-conditioned facility specializes in 

custom jobbing, particularly machining brass, aluminum, and stainless steel. We proudly serve a diverse 

range of industries, including aerospace, medical, chemical, and custom architectural hardware, by 

delivering exceptional machining solutions tailored to each client’s unique specifications.


Our Equipment:

• CNC Vertical Mills Haas/Brother + 4th/5th axis

• Mazak Lathes w/ Bar Feeders

• Mastercam CAD/CAM

• Standard grinding, finishing, saw, and manual machining equipment.

Join our team and be part of a company that values craftsmanship, precision, and long-term client 

relationships!


Drive Precision. Lead Excellence.

Step into a key leadership role at our family-owned shop and take charge of operations where 

craftsmanship meets cutting-edge CNC technology. Apply now to shape processes, inspire teams, and make 

an immediate impact!


We are an equal-opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does 

not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or 

mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender 

identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We 

consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in accordance with applicable laws.

title: Office Administrator (Part-Time)
description_html:
Office Administrator – Part-Time

 

If you love creating structure, keeping things running smoothly, and being the person others rely on, this role is for you. Bridgeway Capital Management is looking for an Office Administrator who enjoys working independently, managing diverse responsibilities, and making a meaningful impact through excellent administrative support. This role is part of our Finance and Talent team and plays a key role in keeping our organization efficient, organized, and well supported.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

At Bridgeway Capital Management, we believe people do their best work when they feel supported, valued, and connected to a meaningful mission. We invest in our team with thoughtful benefits, flexibility, and a culture built on trust, respect, and continuous growth. You’ll find a collaborative environment where your ideas matter, your development is encouraged, and your work makes a real impact — both within the firm and beyond it. For this part-time Office Administrator role, we offer a competitive compensation of $32-$38/hr, commensurate with experience. And, for our full-time employees, we offer: 

  • Comprehensive health coverage, including Medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • Retirement support of a 401(k) plan with employer matching
  • Financial protection, including company-paid life and disability insurance
  • Tax-advantaged savings, including Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
  • Time to recharge, like generous paid time off and holidays, along with flexible scheduling and remote work options
  • Growth-oriented culture that is a collaborative, inclusive environment where learning, contribution, and personal development are encouraged

 

At Bridgeway, you’ll be part of a purpose-driven organization that values excellence, integrity, and service, and a team that genuinely enjoys working together to make a difference.

 

To be successful, you should have:

  • A High school diploma with 2–4 years of experience in an administrative or office support role, preferably within a finance or corporate environment.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams) and navigates standard office systems efficiently.
  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication to support internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ability to manage time, priorities, and details with consistency while operating independently in a fast-paced environment.
  • Solid experience with tools such as Concur, Salesforce, or Smartsheet and values continued professional development through certifications or coursework (e.g., CAP or college degree).

 

Your responsibilities as the Office Administrator will include:

  • Oversee daily office operations, including reception, facilities, supplies, mail, equipment, meetings, and information management to ensure a smooth and professional workplace.
  • Welcome and assist guests while serving as a point of contact for office-related vendors, service providers, and external partners.
  • Coordinate and execute administrative projects such as presentations, print and copy work, event planning, and special initiatives as requested.
  • Maintain records and retention processes for onsite and offsite storage while identifying and implementing improvements to office practices and systems.
  • Provide backup and supplemental administrative support across the firm, including scheduling, travel coordination, and expense reporting, and pursue ongoing professional development.

 

About Us:

At Bridgeway Capital Management, we believe great investing starts with great people. Since 1993, our Houston-based firm has combined disciplined, evidence-based investing with a strong culture built on integrity, service, and respect. We are passionate about putting investors first, and about using our success to make a positive difference in the world by donating our profits to organizations that improve humanity. Our workplace is collaborative, inclusive, and purpose-driven, where individuals are encouraged to grow, contribute, and bring their whole selves to work. We are united by a shared commitment to excellence, impact, and doing what’s right.

 

Ready to make an impact?

If you love creating order, elevating how teams work, and contributing to a purpose-driven organization, we’d love to hear from you. Apply to bring your administrative expertise, initiative, and care for excellence to Bridgeway Capital Management.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Nurse Practitioner - Tucson Area
description_html:
Nurse Practitioner – Tucson Area


We’re Growing Our Nephrology Advanced Practice Provider Team!


Join our dynamic and growing nephrology practice, where NPs, PA’s and physicians work closely together to deliver comprehensive kidney care in clinic, dialysis, and hospital settings, focusing on continuity of care, patient education, and chronic disease management.


Our physicians are expanding services across multiple locations:

  • Tucson
  • Phoenix
  • Flagstaff


We offer:

  • Comprehensive training program and continuing education reimbursement.
  • Professional growth opportunities with mentorship from experienced nephrologists.
  • Competitive compensation $107,000 -$140,000K/year based on experience and credentials, plus potential productivity bonus.
  • Extensive benefits packageincluding:
    • Subsidized Medical, dental, and vision insurance (75%-100%, depending on the selected plan
    • 401(k) plan with employer matching
    • Life and disability insurance for added financial protection
    • Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
    • Malpractice coverage and mileage reimbursement
    • Paid time off and holidays to support well-being and work-life balance.


We take pride in maintaining a positive and collaborative work environment where every team member is valued. We encourage creativity, learning, and professional development — fostering a culture where everyone contributes to our shared success.


Your essential duties and responsibilities as a Nurse Practitioner:

  • Collaborate with AKDHC physicians to provide chronic kidney disease care across multiple settings (dialysis, office, rehab, SNF, hospital, or on call), including diagnostic evaluations and treatment planning.
  • Support care transitions, including annual wellness visits and post-hospital discharge planning.
  • Prescribe or recommend appropriate therapies while maintaining professional and respectful communication with patients and colleagues.

 

Join us and be part of a team that’s changing lives every day.

If you’re an APP who thrives in a collaborative setting and wants to grow alongside a leading nephrology group, we’d love to meet you.

Contact Nancy Fulmore Nfulmore@akdhc.com or apply directly www.akdhc.com >careers


Arizona Kidney Disease and Hypertension Center (AKDHC) is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Nurse Practitioner - Central Phoenix Area
description_html:
Nurse Practitioner - Central Phoenix Area

 

As one of the nation's largest groups of physicians specializing in the care of patients with renal disease, Arizona Kidney Disease and Hypertension Center (AKDHC) has enjoyed the trust of patients and the respect of the community throughout the Phoenix Metropolitan area and across Arizona since 1976. We are a professional medical association consisting of physicians and other vital support staff. To learn more about us, please visit our website: www.akdhc.com. 

 

AKDHC values our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation and an extensive benefits package including:


  • Subsidized health insurance   coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance subsidized at (75%-100%, depending on the plan the employee selects)
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and holidays, including 168 hours to start and more added for each year of employment with AKDHC

 

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

As Nurse Practitioner, you will use your compassionate and empathetic nature to support the clinical care of patients with renal disease. You will work under the direction of the Director of Clinical Services and under the clinical supervision of the physicians to enhance and augment patient care.

 

As Nurse Practitioners, you should have:

  • Master’s degree in nursing or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience (4–10 years).
  • Current Arizona RN license and Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant license.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience with ICD-9 and CPT coding.
  • Solid interpersonal skills, flexible schedule availability, and reliable transportation for travel between sites.

 

Your essential duties and responsibilities as a Nurse Practitioner:

  • Collaborate with AKDHC physicians and dialysis staff to complete and document dialysis visits, addressing medical issues promptly.
  • Provide chronic kidney disease care in office settings and coordinate treatment plans with physicians.
  • Support care transitions, including annual physicals and post-hospital discharge planning.
  • Deliver care across settings (e.g., rehab, SNF, office, or on call), including diagnostic evaluations and treatment planning.
  • Prescribe or recommend appropriate therapies and maintain professional, respectful conduct in all interactions.

 

Join us and be part of a team that is changing lives every day.

We would love to hear from you if you are ready to significantly impact our patients' lives and further your nursing career! Join our dedicated team and be part of something extraordinary.

 

Arizona Kidney Disease and Hypertension Center (AKDHC) is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Nurse Practitioner (NY/FL)
description_html:
Nurse Practitioner

New York, NY, and Miami, FL

 

Our client is redefining how high-performing individuals approach movement, longevity, and recovery, and you will be at the center of that experience. As the Nurse Practitioner, you will guide discerning patients through an elevated clinical journey that blends advanced musculoskeletal expertise with white-glove concierge care. Based in Miami, FL, or New York, NY, you will work within a refined, modern clinical environment that values precision, personalization, and long-term outcomes, not volume-driven care.

 

About Our Client: 

Our client is a luxury, concierge-style healthcare organization focused on mobility, musculoskeletal longevity, and minimally invasive solutions. Serving professionals, longevity-minded individuals, and elite performers, the practice combines advanced diagnostics, proprietary treatment pathways, and state-of-the-art technology with an exceptionally personalized patient experience. The organization is built around preserving and restoring movement through thoughtful, outcomes-driven care that delivers lasting results.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

Our client values their employees’ time and effort. Their competitive compensation is $200,000 to $250,000.  annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package, which enhances their commitment to your success. Our client’s benefits package includes: 

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work choices provided

 

Plus, they work to maintain the best possible environment for their employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. They strive to provide a collaborative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to their processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

As our Nurse Practitioner, you should have:        

  • Active Nurse Practitioner license in New York and/or Florida, or eligibility for multi-state licensure.
  • 6+ years of clinical experience, ideally within orthopedics, sports medicine, or musculoskeletal-focused care.
  • National NP certification required (ANCC or AANP).
  • Ability to comply with the Nurse Practice Acts and scope of practice regulations in both Florida and New York.
  • Compliance with state-required fingerprinting and background checks is required.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in clinical diagnostics, patient education, imaging interpretation, and mobility or functional assessments.
  • Polished communication and decision-guiding abilities suited to high-net-worth and athletic populations, with flexibility to travel between New York and Miami as needed.

 

Your responsibilities as the Nurse Practitioner will include:        

  • Lead initial patient consultations, performing MSK-focused exams and comprehensive diagnostic intakes.
  • Serve as the primary medical and concierge touchpoint, educating patients on the care philosophy, services, and treatment pathways.
  • Confidently guide qualified patients into scheduled physician consults through clear, empathetic communication.
  • Oversee and support advanced diagnostic experiences, including imaging, motion analysis, and ultrasound evaluations (training provided).
  • Collaborate with physicians to synthesize findings, coordinate next steps, and document care within the EHR while maintaining a luxury concierge standard across all interactions.

 

 

Ready to Redefine What an NP Role Can Be?

Step into a career where clinical mastery meets elevated patient experience. Apply now to be part of a team shaping the future of musculoskeletal longevity in Miami and New York.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.
