title: Medical Assistant, Back Office - Tucson Northwest Office
description_html:
Arizona Kidney Disease and Hypertension Centers (AKDHC) is one of the nation's largest groups of physicians specializing in the care of patients with renal disease. Since 1976, we have enjoyed the trust of patients and the respect of the community throughout the Phoenix Metropolitan area and across Arizona. We are a professional medical association consisting of physicians and other vital support staff. We are seeking Medical Assistants to join our team. To learn more about us, please visit our website: www.akdhc.com. 


 

Medical Assistant, Back Office - AKDHC Tucson Northwest Office


 

Under the direction of the Office Coordinator, the Medical Assistant, Back Office will be responsible for performing general medical assistant functions in support of the care and treatment of patients while providing assistance to all office personnel as needed. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Perform patient care activities, such as back-office check-in, check-out, prescription refills, anemia, and iron management, administer injections, schedule procedures and provide patient education.
  • Schedule and process 24-hour blood pressure monitoring.
  • Interview patients, measure vital signs, such as pulse rate, temperature, blood pressure, weight, height; and update medication list; record information in patients’ charts/EMR to include urine tests per Clinitek.
  • Notify physician of changes in patient’s clinical status and/or abnormal test results.
  • Collect urine samples and process specimens for courier transport.
  • Monitor and optimize allotted time slots in all schedules utilizing the available programs/reports.
  • Complete clerical tasks including but not limited to distributing mail and reports, filing, scanning, scheduling, data input, answering phones and general support to all office personnel.
  • Adhere to company policies and procedures and prioritize and complete day to day activities.
  • Maintain office equipment, office, and medical supplies through efficient inventory management.
  • Process Hospital Disposition Reports.
  • Process Recall Reports and mail recall and no-show letters to patients; follow up with patients and/or primary care physicians as needed.
  • Monitor dictation process by maintaining accurate dictation logs, ensuring physician review and signature, mailing report and scanning dictation into patient files.
  • Process medical record requests for patients, referring physician offices and attorneys by adhering to HIPAA regulations to ensure HPI.
  • Assist in the annual purging process of patient charts.
  • May be required to report to alternate AKDHC worksites, as directed.

 

Qualifications:

  • Current certification as a Medical Assistant or a diploma or certificate of completion of a Medical Assistant course of training from an accredited training organization
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills for interfacing with patients, staff, and outside vendors
  • 1-2 years front/back office experience preferred
  • Ability to support a pleasant, positive, and cooperative teamwork environment
  • The successful candidate must be able to use a stethoscope, computer, scanner, printer, telephone, fax, and copier.
  • Ability to multi-task and lift and/or move 50 pounds essential.

 

Benefits:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Process Recall Reports and mail recall and no-show letters to patients; follow up with patients and/or primary care physicians as needed.
Monitor dictation process by maintaining accurate dictation logs, ensuring physician review and signature, mailing report and scanning dictation into patient files.
Process medical record requests for patients, referring physician offices and attorneys by adhering to HIPAA regulations to ensure HPI.
Assist in the annual purging process of patient charts.
May be required to report to alternate AKDHC worksites, as directed.
Qualifications:
Current certification as a Medical Assistant or a diploma or certificate of completion of a Medical Assistant course of training from an accredited training organization
Excellent customer service and communication skills for interfacing with patients, staff, and outside vendors
1-2 years front/back office experience preferred
Ability to support a pleasant, positive, and cooperative teamwork environment
The successful candidate must be able to use a stethoscope, computer, scanner, printer, telephone, fax, and copier.
Ability to multi-task and lift and/or move 50 pounds essential.
Benefits:
We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Medical Assistant
description_html:
Medical Assistant 

 

Are you a compassionate and driven individual with a passion for helping others? Do you want to be part of a dynamic team at the forefront of cancer treatment and research? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! 

 

The Berenson Cancer Center is led by a world-renowned oncologist and researcher, James R. Berenson, MD, a pioneer in creating cutting-edge therapies for patients with myeloma and associated blood cancers. We're seeking a skilled Medical Assistant to join our team and play a vital role in supporting our healthcare professionals as we work to improve the lives of our patients. Our office is located near Beverly Hills in the Sunset Medical Tower in West Hollywood, California. 

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:  

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation of $24-$27 per hour, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Health benefits, including medical, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401(k) retirement plan with employer matching
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health savings account
  • Paid time off and holidays
  • Flexible schedule
  • Employee assistance program
  • Professional development assistance

 

Plus, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees, where they can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

As a detail-oriented Medical Assistant, you should have:

  • Certificate/diploma showing completion of medical assistant courses/training
  • CPR training certificate
  • Phlebotomy certification
  • 2-3 years of clinic/hospital experience 
  • Excellent analytical and verbal communication skills
  • Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to multitask

 

 Your responsibilities as the Medical Assistant will include:

  • Initiate patient visit in EMR, which includes taking patient vitals 
  • Keep continuous patient flow in the clinic, patients in the room, and other RN’s patients
  • Complete pharmacy refills in the EMR portal
  • Receive patient phone calls and fax requests for refills, responding in a timely fashion
  • Place medical supplies orders under the supervision of the head nurse
  • Draw blood, give injections, and perform EKGs (if needed)
  • Assist Dr. Berenson with bone marrow biopsies
  • Restock medical supply carts in the clinic as needed
  • Update chart lab result reports for patients seen in the clinic daily
  • Assist in turnover of clinic rooms between patients by cleaning and restocking necessary supplies
  • Keep updated inventory logs and manage clinic/pharmacy supply inventory 
  • Administrative duties as assigned (pre-authorizations, filing, scheduling, VOB, etc.)
  • Other medical assistant duties as needed

 

Ready to make a difference in the lives of our patients? 

Join us in our mission to provide exceptional care, support, and hope to individuals facing the challenges of cancer. Together, we can make a difference! 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. 

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

title: Manager of Development and Fundraising
description_html:
Manager of Development & Fundraising

New Ground

Location: Levittown, NY

 

Are you driven by purpose and inspired to make a lasting difference in your community? At New Ground, we’ve spent over 35 years helping Long Islanders break the cycle of homelessness and poverty by providing immediate support, long-term guidance, and the tools to build independent, successful lives. Now, we’re looking for a Manager of Development & Fundraising to help grow our impact by cultivating meaningful donor relationships, leading strategic campaigns, and advancing partnerships that align with our mission. If you’re ready to combine your leadership skills with a passion for social change, this is your opportunity to help shape a brighter future for our community.  

You can learn more about us at www.newground.org.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

New Ground values our employees’ time and efforts. Competitive compensation of $75,000 to $85,000 annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package highlight our commitment to your success. The benefits package includes: 

  • Comprehensive 100% employer-paid health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided at no cost to the employee 
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: 11 paid holidays and other paid time off opportunities 

 

New Ground is an approved qualifying employer under the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF). Employees in this position may qualify for student loan forgiveness.

 

We also maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We provide ample professional growth and development opportunities within the field of Social Work. We strive to provide a collaborative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture. 

 

To succeed, you should have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Nonprofit Management, Business, Marketing, or related field required.
  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience in fundraising, development, or related nonprofit work.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills for donor correspondence and presentations.
  • Strong organizational and problem-solving skills; ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Proficiency in donor management systems, preferably DonorPerfect or similar systems, Microsoft Office Suite, Canva, and online fundraising tools.

 

Your responsibilities as the Manager of Development & Fundraising will include:

  • Assist in developing and executing annual fundraising plans, including donor outreach, events, and campaigns.
  • Manage donor databases and ensure accurate recordkeeping for contributions and stewardship activities.
  • Coordinate logistics for the overall agency’s fundraising calendar and key donor meetings.
  • Prepare reports on fundraising progress and donor engagement for leadership review.
  • Cultivate and maintain relationships with donors and prospects.
  • Supervise Event Coordinator, helping ensure smooth and successful execution of all fundraising events.
  • Oversee marketing and communications generated with the assistance of the Event Coordinator to create donor-focused content and materials.
  • Ensure compliance with fundraising regulations and ethical standards.
  • Support grant research and proposal development in collaboration with the Executive Director, the Board, and the grants committee.

 

Lead the Change at New Ground!

Use your passion and expertise to drive fundraising, build powerful partnerships, and transform lives. Apply now to help break the cycle of homelessness and poverty in Long Island!

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in accordance with applicable laws.

title: Manager In Training
description_html:
Manager in Training

 

Katoen Natie, a global leader in logistics, engineering, and port operations, delivers tailor-made solutions to the chemical, automotive, consumer goods, electronics, and retail sectors. With 181 logistics platforms in 40 countries and over 18,000 employees, we are growing our U.S. operations and seeking a motivated Manager in Training in La Porte, TX. You will participate in an intensive, hands-on training program that provides exposure to all aspects of facility operations, including packaging, warehousing, logistics, and distribution. You will tackle real-world challenges, develop problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, and work closely with experienced managers to understand operational planning, team supervision, KPI monitoring, and resource management. After completing the training program, you will step into a managerial position, leading teams and contributing to the continued growth and success of Katoen Natie in the U.S.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits:

Recognizing your hard work and commitment, we offer training and a valuable introduction to a dynamic, expanding organization in the USA and internationally. Why become part of our team? You'll experience a collaborative and inclusive work culture where innovation and teamwork are encouraged, and every contribution is valued and appreciated. We also offer significant opportunities for professional growth, ensuring access to ongoing learning and career advancement within a global organization.

 

Our extensive compensation and benefits package includes:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance, life and disability insurance, flexible spending, and health savings accounts are also offered.
  • Retirement planning: 401(k) plan with employer matching.
  • Work-life balance: Generous paid time off and holidays.
  • Competitive Salary: $50,000 annually.
  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment: Join a creative, supportive, and dynamic team where every voice matters.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development: Access to continuous learning and career advancement in a global organization.

 

To be successful as our Manager in Training, you should have: 

  • Bachelor’s degree and solid analytical skills, with the ability to define problems, collect data, and draw valid conclusions.
  • Proficient in computer applications, including MS Word and Excel, with the ability to create concise reports, statistics, and graphs.
  • Dynamic, persistent personality with excellent interpersonal and team collaboration skills; leads by example.
  • Fluency in English (read, write, speak) required; bilingual in Spanish is a plus.
  • Willingness to travel nationally and internationally, including relocation to the U.S., and flexibility to work outside regular hours as needed.
  • Physically capable of performing warehouse duties, including lifting to 50 lbs., standing for extended periods, and working safely in noisy or physically demanding environments.

 

Ready to Make an Impact?

At KTN, every role matters. You’ll be empowered to contribute, grow, and make a difference in a company committed to your success. Don’t miss out on the chance to join an industry-leading team!

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Machine Operator
description_html:
Machine Operator

For 50 years, Biotics Research Corporation has been at the forefront of the nutrition industry, renowned for our top-quality supplements and innovative product delivery systems. Our commitment to advancement is driven by our focus on research initiatives, unique product formulations, and unparalleled quality control. As a family-owned company with a rich history, we take pride in our valued partnerships with healthcare professionals, ensuring that our products meet the highest standards of excellence.

This position is responsible for ensuring products are manufactured in accordance with FDA regulatory requirements as well as company procedures and policies.


Essential responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Assemble, sanitize, and operate tablet presses or encapsulating machines.
  • Monitor product for quality defects during production runs.
  • Calibrate machines and adjust settings to meet product specifications.
  • Maintain production cell cleanliness and compliance with GMP standards.
  • Record tablet and capsule weights, thickness, and hardness on Production Batch Records.
  • Perform basic machine troubleshooting and alert supervisor of issues.
  • Account for and record all losses during production runs.
  • Move finished products to staging areas and clean equipment post-production.
  • Work collaboratively with team members and demonstrate professionalism.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Work Requirements and Skills

  • High School Diploma or equivalent (GED) required.
  • Previous experience preferred but not required.
  • Ability to read, write, and communicate in English.
  • Must complete BRC Production Operator training.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Flexibility for overtime as needed.

Benefits

  • 401(k) with company contribution
  • Incentive pay
  • 16 days PTO plus holidays
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Life and disability coverage
  • Professional development assistance
  • Flexible spending account
  • Referral program
  • Career growth path
  • In-house product allowance


We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Licensed Paraplanner
description_html:
Licensed Paraplanner 

 

Are you ready to make a meaningful impact in people’s lives, one financial plan at a time? Our client is seeking a Licensed Paraplanner who brings precision, initiative, and a client-first mindset to a vibrant, full-service advisory team. You will collaborate directly with financial advisors, prepare comprehensive plans, conduct research, and ensure every client’s data and strategy are in perfect shape, starting with a 6-month probationary period. This opportunity is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, high-expectation environment and is committed to going the extra mile. 

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture: 

Our client values the time and efforts of their employees. Their commitment to employee success is reflected in competitive compensation based on experience, bonus potential after 12 months of employment, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes: 

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and flexible schedule

 

Additionally, our client fosters an environment that enables employees to learn, grow, and thrive. They promote a collaborative and creative workplace culture where every team member is encouraged to contribute to ongoing processes, decisions, planning, and the company's growth. 

 

To succeed as a Licensed Paraplanner, you should have:         

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field, with at least 5 years of experience in financial planning, wealth management, or a client service advisory environment.
  • FINRA Series 7 and 66 (or 65 & 63) licenses required; Life, Health, and Variable Insurance licenses preferred or in progress.
  • Solid proficiency in eMoney, Microsoft Office Suite, CRM platforms, and financial planning or FinTech tools; ability to quickly adapt to emerging technologies and AI efficiency applications.
  • Solid analytical, organizational, and communication skills with strong attention to detail, initiative, and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Solid English language skills; able to read, write, and communicate professionally with clients and colleagues. Occasional travel may be required for client meetings, conferences, training sessions, or firm events, both within the local area and outside the state.
  • Registered Paraplanner (RP®) designation preferred
  • CFP® coursework completed or in progress preferred

 

Your responsibilities as the Licensed Paraplanner will include:         

  • Develop and maintain financial plans: Prepare and update comprehensive financial plans, investment proposals, and retirement projections using tools like eMoney under the direction of the financial professional.
  • Analyze and organize client data: Gather, verify, and interpret client financial information, including assets, liabilities, income, expenses, and risk tolerance, to support plan accuracy.
  • Execute trades and transactions: Process trades and model rebalancing for investment accounts in accordance with the advisor’s documented instructions.
  • Support client meetings and onboarding: Prepare meeting materials, assist in onboarding new clients, take detailed meeting notes, and manage post-meeting follow-ups.
  • Ensure compliance and service excellence: Maintain adherence to regulatory and firm policies while coordinating client service requests and helping resolve issues efficiently.

 

About Our Client 

Our client’s primary purpose is simple yet profound: to deliver tailored, high-impact financial solutions that help individuals envision and achieve a meaningful, purpose-driven future. They believe in a team-based approach that brings together diverse backgrounds, education, and experience to ensure each client receives a strategy designed specifically for their goals. Their team provides undivided attention from planning through execution and ongoing follow-up, anticipating challenges, identifying opportunities, and maintaining a firm focus on client success. Serving primarily pre-retirees and retirees, our client understands that sound decisions today shape a secure tomorrow, which is why their professionals are dedicated to helping clients make informed choices with confidence. 

 

They are energetic, collaborative, and client-service focused. Their client-first culture demands top performance and a can-do attitude while fostering a supportive workplace built on teamwork, integrity, and excellence. 

 

Join Our Client’s Team as a Licensed Paraplanner 

Our client is seeking a Licensed Paraplanner ready to take their financial planning expertise to the next level and make a meaningful impact on clients’ futures. They’re looking for a professional who brings skill, initiative, and passion to a collaborative, fast-paced team where every contribution drives results and inspires confidence. 

  

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. They do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. 


#ZCL


#PRO

Solid English language skills; able to read, write, and communicate professionally with clients and colleagues. Occasional travel may be required for client meetings, conferences, training sessions, or firm events, both within the local area and outside the state.
Registered Paraplanner (RP®) designation preferred
CFP® coursework completed or in progress preferred
Your responsibilities as the Licensed Paraplanner will include:
Develop and maintain financial plans: Prepare and update comprehensive financial plans, investment proposals, and retirement projections using tools like
eMoney
under the direction of
the
financial professional.
Analyze and organize client data: Gather, verify, and interpret client financial information, including assets, liabilities, income, expenses, and risk tolerance, to support plan accuracy.
Execute trades and transactions: Process trades and model rebalancing for investment accounts in accordance with the advisor’s documented instructions.
Support client meetings and onboarding: Prepare meeting materials, assist in onboarding new clients, take detailed meeting notes, and manage post-meeting follow-ups.
Ensure compliance and service excellence: Maintain adherence to regulatory and firm policies while coordinating client service requests and helping resolve issues efficiently.
About Our Client
Our client’s primary purpose is simple yet profound: to deliver tailored, high-impact financial solutions that help individuals envision and achieve a meaningful, purpose-driven future. They believe in a team-based approach that brings together diverse backgrounds, education, and experience to ensure each client receives a strategy designed specifically for their goals. Their team provides undivided attention from planning through execution and ongoing follow-up, anticipating challenges, identifying opportunities, and maintaining a firm focus on client success. Serving primarily pre-retirees and retirees, our client understands that sound decisions today shape a secure tomorrow, which is why their professionals are dedicated to helping clients make informed choices with confidence.
They are energetic, collaborative, and client-service focused. Their client-first culture demands top performance and a can-do attitude while fostering a supportive workplace built on teamwork, integrity, and excellence.
Join Our Client’s Team as a Licensed Paraplanner
Our client is seeking a Licensed Paraplanner ready to take their financial planning expertise to the next level and make a meaningful impact on clients’ futures. They’re looking for a professional who brings skill, initiative, and passion to a collaborative, fast-paced team where every contribution drives results and inspires confidence.
Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. They do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Legal Assistant
description_html:
Legal Assistant 

 

We are a small, well-established West Houston law firm seeking a full-time legal secretary/legal assistant with at least 3 years of experience representing lenders in commercial real estate loan transactions, who we can rely on to assist attorneys in preparing commercial loan documentation for our lender clients.  

 

What Benefits Are Available to You:  

We offer exceptional benefits to our employees. In addition to a competitive salary of $40,000 to $60,000 annually, commensurate with experience, we offer an excellent career path. We offer one of the best available benefit programs for small businesses, including: 

  • Medical insurance for the employee. Medical insurance for employee’s family is available with premiums paid by the employee
  • Dental and vision insurance is available with a portion of the premium paid by the employee
  • 401K plan
  • 2 weeks of vacation PTO plus 6 days sick/personal time per year

 

We work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.  

 

You Should Have:  

  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Experience as a legal secretary/legal assistant in commercial real estate law
  • Knowledge of commercial real estate lending, including loan structures, loan documentation, title work, and issue recognition
  • Exceptional ability multitasked be accurate and efficient, and an ability to work with others in a high-volume environment
  • Solid verbal and written communication skills, along with attention to detail and proofreading skills, including the ability to review large amounts of detailed documents for accuracy
  • Proficiency in WordPerfect, Microsoft Word, and Excel
  • Reliable transportation and attendance

 

Your Will Be Responsible For: 

  • Preparation of loan documentation for real estate loans for banks
  • Reviewing title commitments, surveys, and organizational documents of corporate entity loan parties
  • Communicating with lenders and title companies
  • Day-to-day upkeep with the status of files

 

Join Our Legal Team
Step into the world of commercial real estate law where your precision, speed, and expertise keep transactions moving and our clients happy. Bring your mastery of loan docs and title work; we’ll give you great benefits, career growth, and a collaborative crew ready to win with you. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Laboratory Accessioner
description_html:
Laboratory Intake Technician (Accessioner)

 

Step into a role where precision meets purpose. As a Laboratory Intake Tech (Accessioner) at Brazos Neuroscience, you’ll be at the frontline of a mission-driven team transforming the way traumatic brain injuries are understood and diagnosed. This is your opportunity to contribute to life-changing work—ensuring each specimen is handled with accuracy, care, and integrity so clinicians and patients can rely on the insights that follow. If you thrive in a detail-oriented environment and want to make a meaningful impact on others' lives, we’d love to meet you.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work choices provided

 

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To thrive as a Laboratory Technician, you should have:        

  • High school diploma or equivalent required; BS in a life science–related field preferred.
  • 0–2 years of laboratory experience in biotech or healthcare, with comfort using specialized lab instruments and software.
  • Basic computer proficiency, including navigating multiple systems such as LIS and standard office applications.
  • Solid problem-solving, communication, organization, and time-management skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to multitask and work effectively in both independent and team environments.

 

Your responsibilities as the Laboratory Accessioner will include:        

  • Accession and document specimens accurately, including labeling, data entry, and verification of patient and specimen information.
  • Ensure specimen integrity and workflow readiness by identifying issues, taking corrective action, and properly handling, organizing, and archiving samples.
  • Follow all laboratory protocols, safety procedures, and regulatory standards to maintain compliance and quality.
  • Coordinate logistics and communication with internal teams and external partners to support timely deliveries, problem resolution, and accurate test orders.
  • Maintain an efficient, well-organized work environment, including inventory management, equipment care, and upkeep of required logs.

 

Ready to Join a Mission That Moves Science Forward?

Bring your precision, curiosity, and drive to a team reshaping the future of TBI diagnostics—apply now and become an essential force behind breakthrough patient care. Your next career leap starts here. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Jr Implementation Engineer
description_html:
Junior Implementation Engineer – Hybrid 

 

Are you ready to take your career to the next level in the world of IT? Do you have a passion for building and optimizing cutting-edge digital infrastructures? If so, we want YOU to join our client’s forward-thinking team as a Junior Implementation Engineer.

 

At Panurgy, we deliver comprehensive IT services to businesses across New Jersey, New York, and Charlotte. Since 2000, we’ve specialized in managed IT, cloud solutions, cybersecurity, and business continuity, ensuring our clients' systems are secure, efficient, and up to date. We offer tailored IT solutions to meet the diverse needs of businesses, providing round-the-clock support and expert guidance. Our goal is to keep your operations running smoothly while helping your business grow.

 

We are expanding our team with an experienced Junior Implementation Engineer to handle field installation and support for network servers, SAN, data/voice infrastructure, virtualization, and security solutions. Additionally, the role includes working in our Network Operations Center to configure and monitor security solutions, provide remote support and administration, deploy and support virtual servers within our cloud services (IaaS), and assist with solution design and project management. The position also requires participation in a rotating emergency on-call schedule. Compensation is based on experience and certifications, with opportunities for career growth, ongoing professional development, and access to training and certifications. This role is based at our corporate headquarters in Cedar Knolls, NJ, with travel to client sites in the NJ/NY metro area (using a company car), as well as work from the office and/or remotely from home.

 

You should possess strong troubleshooting and analytical skills, along with extensive hands-on experience in the design, installation, configuration, support, and administration of LAN, WAN, and security systems. In addition, expertise in Microsoft Server and Desktop platforms and VMware virtualization is essential. The ideal candidate will also be an excellent communicator, capable of effectively engaging clients and team members on projects and support requirements.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We believe in investing in our team members and providing opportunities for growth and development. An annual salary of $80,000 to $100,000 reflects their commitment to your success and is commensurate with their experience and certifications. Opportunities for career growth and continued professional development, training, and certifications. When you join our team, you'll enjoy:

  • Well-Being and Work-Life Balance: paid time off, holidays, and hybrid work opportunities
  • Comprehensive Health coverage: medical, dental, and vision benefits
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Professional Development: employer-paid continuing education, comprehensive ongoing training and certification assistance, and future growth opportunities within the company
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered

 

Additionally, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees, where they can learn, grow, and thrive within the company. We aim to provide a collaborative and creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to their processes, decisions, planning, and the overall culture.

 

To be successful, you should have:

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in an MSP environment supporting Windows Server (Active Directory, Group Policy, DFS), Microsoft 365 (Exchange, SharePoint, Teams), and endpoint management platforms such as Intune and MDM.
  • Practical experience installing, configuring, and maintaining virtualization and cloud platforms, including VMware, Hyper-V, and Azure Virtual Machines, with the ability to optimize performance and resource utilization.
  • Applied knowledge of LAN/WAN networking and security, including deployment and support of firewalls, switches, wireless access points, VPNs, and network monitoring and protection technologies.
  • MCSA, Microsoft 365 Associate, or equivalent technical certification, along with disciplined problem analysis, troubleshooting, documentation, and time management practices.
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills, client-focused service mindset, ability to work independently and collaboratively, and willingness to travel to client sites within the NJ/NY metro area and participate in on-call rotations.

 

Our client prefers that top candidates have:

  • Experience administering and supporting EMC Storage Area Networks (SAN) is a plus.
  • Microsoft MCSE or advanced M365/Azure certifications strongly preferred.
  • Security+ certifications preferred.
  • Experience with Cisco DUO
  • Experience with ConnectWise
  • Experience with SonicWall Firewalls

 

What you’ll do as the Junior Implementation Engineer:

  • Provide Level 2 technical support and troubleshooting for escalated infrastructure, network, cloud, and security issues, both remotely and onsite.
  • Design, implement, and support network, server, storage, virtualization, and cloud solutions, including upgrades and optimization of existing environments.
  • Deploy, manage, and secure cloud and SaaS platforms (e.g., Azure, Microsoft 365), backups, and disaster recovery solutions to ensure availability and data protection.
  • Implement and maintain security controls, monitoring, and incident response processes to protect client and internal systems from threats and vulnerabilities.
  • Contribute to project delivery and operational excellence through technical design, documentation, time tracking, and participation in an emergency on-call rotation.

 

Who is Panuary?

For over two decades, Panuary has been a leading IT Managed Services Provider to mid-market companies throughout North America. We design, install, and support local and wide area data networks and VoIP communications systems, and provide 24x7 monitoring, administration, help desk, data protection, virtualization, Infrastructure as a Service hosting, business continuity/disaster recovery, and a robust suite of managed security services to our contract clients throughout North America.

 

We hold various authorizations and certifications, including Microsoft Silver Partner, VMware Enterprise Partner, Dell EMC Partner, SonicWALL SecureFirst Partner, and partnerships with HP, Avaya, CoreDial, among others.

 

Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you're ready to take your career to new heights and be part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of IT, we want to hear from you! Please apply now to join us on this exciting journey. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Human Resources Administrator
description_html:
Human Resources Administrator

(Hybrid) 

 

Our client is seeking a detail-oriented and people-centered Human Resources Administrator to play a key role in delivering an exceptional employee experience. In this role, you will serve as the central liaison between employees and an external HR partner, overseeing core human resources functions, including recruitment, training, performance management, compensation, and benefits administration. As an ideal candidate, you should bring precision, professionalism, and a collaborative mindset to a role that balances strategic HR coordination with essential day-to-day operations, fostering a positive, inclusive, and well-supported workplace.

 

About Our Client:

Our client is united by a clear and meaningful purpose: empowering higher education leaders to govern with insight, confidence, and strategic vision. As a mission-driven organization focused on advancing excellence in board leadership across colleges, universities, and foundations, our client delivers research, guidance, and solutions that influence the future of higher education. Employees join a collaborative, values-based team where innovation, inclusion, and impact are prioritized, and where individual expertise helps turn complex challenges into lasting opportunities for institutions and leaders nationwide.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

Our client values their employees’ time and efforts. Their commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation between at $70,000 - $104,000 annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work choices provided

 

Plus, they work to maintain the best environment for their employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. They strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to the client’s processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To succeed as the Human Resources Administrator, you should have:        

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field, with HR certification considered an asset.
  • 5+ years of progressive HR generalist experience spanning recruitment, employee relations, benefits, payroll, compliance, and performance management.
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), HRIS platforms, and technology tools that improve efficiency and accuracy in HR operations.
  • Polished written and verbal communication abilities, paired with high emotional intelligence, sound judgment, and the discretion required to manage sensitive and confidential matters.

 

Your responsibilities as the Human Resources Administrator will include:        

  • Serve as the primary liaison with the external HR partner, coordinating recruitment, onboarding, performance management, employee relations, leave administration, and offboarding processes.
  • Lead end-to-end talent acquisition activities, including job description development, candidate screening, interview coordination, background checks, and seamless new-hire onboarding.
  • Administer and manage employee benefits programs, ensuring accurate enrollments, compliance with plan documents, clear employee communications, audits, and issue resolution.
  • Oversee payroll, HRIS, retirement plan contributions, and related compliance activities, partnering closely with finance, payroll administrators, and external vendors.
  • Support organizational leadership by fostering positive employee relations, coordinating staff meetings and engagement initiatives, and delivering training and development programs.
  • Maintain precise, confidential personnel records and HR data, reconcile HR-related expenses and invoices, generate reports, and ensure operational excellence across all HR administrative functions.

 

 

Ready to elevate the employee experience?

Step into a high-impact HR role where your expertise shapes people operations, strengthens culture, and drives organizational excellence. Apply now and help create a workplace where both employees and the mission thrive.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. They do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. They will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in accordance with applicable laws.

Administer and manage employee benefits programs, ensuring accurate enrollments, compliance with plan documents, clear employee communications, audits, and issue resolution.
Oversee payroll, HRIS, retirement plan contributions, and related compliance activities, partnering closely with finance, payroll administrators, and external vendors.
Support organizational leadership by fostering positive employee relations, coordinating staff meetings and engagement initiatives, and delivering training and development programs.
Maintain precise, confidential personnel records and HR data, reconcile HR-related expenses and invoices, generate reports, and ensure operational excellence across all HR administrative functions.
Ready to elevate the employee experience?
Step into a high-impact HR role where your expertise shapes people operations, strengthens culture, and drives organizational excellence. Apply now and help create a workplace where both employees and the mission thrive.

title: HSEQ Manager (Safety)
description_html:
HSEQ Manager

 

Katoen Natie, a global leader in logistics, engineering, and port operations, delivers tailor-made solutions to the chemical, automotive, consumer goods, electronics, and retail sectors. With 181 logistics platforms in 40 countries and more than 18,000 employees worldwide, we continue to expand our U.S. operations. We are currently seeking a driven and experienced HSQE Manager to lead our Specialty Chemicals site in Lugoff, SC. In this key leadership role, you will oversee daily packaging, shipping, receiving, and housekeeping activities while driving health, safety, quality, and environmental excellence across the facility. You will work closely with operational and management teams to ensure compliance, continuous improvement, and the highest standards of operational performance.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits:

Recognizing your hard work and commitment, we offer training and a valuable introduction to a dynamic, expanding organization in the USA and internationally. Why become part of our team? You'll experience a collaborative and inclusive work culture where innovation and teamwork are encouraged, and every contribution is valued and appreciated. We also offer significant opportunities for professional growth, ensuring access to ongoing learning and career advancement within a global organization.

 

Our extensive compensation and benefits package include:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance, life and disability insurance, flexible spending, and health savings accounts are also offered.
  • Retirement planning: 401(k) plan with employer matching.
  • Work-life balance: Generous paid time off and holidays.
  • Competitive Salary: $75,000-$80,000 annually, based on experience.
  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment: Join a creative, supportive, and dynamic team where every voice matters.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development: Access to continuous learning and career advancement in a global organization.

 

To be successful as our HSQE Manager, you should have: 

  • Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent operational management experience
  • Strong leadership background in industrial or chemical environments
  • Deep understanding of quality standards and process compliance (QM28)
  • Proficiency in operational software and systems
  • Excellent communication, organization, and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in both indoor and outdoor conditions and perform physically demanding tasks as needed

 

Your responsibilities as the HSEQ Manager will include:

  • Lead and develop a high-performing team across packaging, shipping, and technical operations
  • Ensure compliance with all safety, quality, and productivity standards
  • Drive KPI performance and lead continuous improvement initiatives
  • Manage labor scheduling, planning, inventory control, and equipment use
  • Conduct audits, lead team evaluations, and promote a culture of safety and accountability
  • Collaborate closely with the Facility Manager and management team to resolve issues and optimize operations

 

Ready to Lead and Make an Impact?

Join Katoen Natie in Lugoff, SC and take on a high-impact leadership role where safety, quality, and operational excellence drive global success. Apply now to shape the future of logistics with an industry leader.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Help Desk / Network Analyst
description_html:
Help Desk / Network Analyst - Remote

Hours: Monday – Friday 9:30 am – 6:00 pm

 

Our client has an immediate opening for an EXPERIENCED Help Desk / Network Analyst II-III to fill a highly active, hands-on position. We are seeking candidates in the Cedar Knolls, NJ area, as well as in PA, VA, KY, NC, and FL. This position will be either HYBRID or REMOTE, depending on the location. 

 

For this Help Desk/Network Analyst role, you will provide our clients with server and end-user help desk, as well as network administration support services. More specifically, this position offers telephone and email-based technical support to client end-users with PC/MAC problems, as well as server and network administration for client servers and networks. You will also respond to network monitoring alarms, remediating or escalating issues to Level 3 Engineers when necessary. Your on-site work may consist of deploying hardware, troubleshooting, or performing other needed services for our clients. There are opportunities for advancement to Network Engineer and Project Management positions.

 

To be successful, you should have:

  • 3+ years IT help desk/network administration/support experience MANDATORY - Level II-III
  • Experience working for an IT Managed Service Provider (MSP) is a significant plus
  • General Windows PC and server technical skills
  • Exceptional problem-solving and customer service skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work as part of a team
  • MUST have experience with Microsoft Office 365, antivirus and malware tools and applications, Windows Server, Exchange Server, and Terminal Server administration and support
  • Experience working with ticketing systems / RMM
  • PC and Macintosh support proficiency
  • Certifications, such as CompTIA A+/N+/S+ and Microsoft desktop/server certifications, are a plus
  • Router and firewall skills a plus
  • Avaya phone system administration experience is a plus

 

Why work for our client?

We are a growing company with a collaborative team environment and excellent career opportunities! We cover the costs of ongoing training and certification.

 

Benefits:

We value the time and efforts of our employees. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation $28-32 hourly, depending on experience, and a comprehensive benefits package, which includes paid time off, medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as ongoing training and certification assistance, and opportunities for future growth within the company. Additionally, we strive to create and maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where they can learn and grow within the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

Who are we?

For over two decades, we have been a leading IT Managed Services Provider to mid-market companies throughout North America. We design, install, and support local and wide-area data networks and VoIP communications systems, and provide 24/7 monitoring, administration, help desk, data protection, virtualization, Infrastructure as a Service hosting, business continuity/disaster recovery, and a robust suite of managed security services to our contract clients throughout North America. We have recently been awarded the 2022 Channel Futures MSP 501 Award, ranked #35 out of 501 MSPs worldwide.

 

We hold various authorizations and certifications, including Microsoft Silver Partner, VMware Enterprise Partner, Dell EMC Partner, SonicWALL SecureFirst Partner, and partnerships with HP, IBM, Avaya, among others. 

 

Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you're ready to take your career to new heights and be part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of IT, we want to hear from you! Please apply now to join our client on this exciting journey. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Financial Controller
description_html:
Finance Controller-Remote

 

TorchStone Global is a rapidly growing global security firm where precision, trust, and accountability matter at every level. As we scale, we’re seeking a seasoned Financial Controller to build and lead a sophisticated accounting function that ensures accurate, confident, and clear financial reporting. This is a high-impact role for an expert in GAAP and QuickBooks Online who thrives on ownership, strengthens internal controls, and partners closely with leadership to turn financial data into strategic insight. If you’re ready to shape the financial backbone of a global organization, TorchStone is where your expertise will matter most.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

We value the time and efforts of our employees. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation of $150,000-$180,000, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, remote work

 

Additionally, we strive to create an optimal environment for our employees in which they can learn and grow within the company. We strive to create a collaborative and creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To thrive as the Finance Controller, you should have:        

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline; CPA or CMA certification preferred.
  • 7–15+ years of progressive accounting experience, including Controller or Assistant Controller roles in high-growth, private companies.
  • Advanced expertise in QuickBooks Online, including optimization for multi-entity, multi–revenue-stream, or project-based environments.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of GAAP, technical accounting practices, and financial management principles such as cash management, budgeting, forecasting, and analysis.
  • Proven capability to perform complex reconciliations, prepare detailed financial reports, and translate financial data into strategic insights.

 

Your responsibilities as the Finance Controller will include:        

  • Lead all accounting activities, including journal entries, reconciliations, accruals, and the monthly close process in compliance with GAAP.
  • Serve as the internal expert on QuickBooks Online, overseeing AR/AP, payroll allocations, expense categorization, and scalable accounting workflows.
  • Prepare and analyze monthly financial reports, including variance and trend analysis, to support leadership decision-making.
  • Strengthen and maintain internal controls, documentation, and compliance, supporting audits, tax, and external reporting needs.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with finance, operations, and business leaders to ensure accurate revenue and cost recognition.
  • Willing to travel to Tennessee approximately once a quarter

 

Ready to Build the Financial Backbone of a Global Security Leader?

If you’re a seasoned accounting professional who thrives in fast-growth environments and loves turning complexity into clarity, this is your moment to lead, scale, and make a lasting impact. Apply now and help TorchStone shape a future built on precision, trust, and financial excellence.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.

title: Finance and Accounting Clerk
description_html:
Finance and Accounting Clerk

 

Who is Colorado Gives Foundation?

Colorado Gives Foundation connects people, ideas and Colorado nonprofits to make good happen. We are a Jefferson County grantmaker and statewide, we invest to build the capacity of nonprofits and donors through ColoradoGives.org, nonprofit endowments and donor services. We make it easy for people to donate to the causes they care about, enabling meaningful change to help our neighbors thrive. Colorado Gives Foundation is where donors find and discover the community impact that matters most to them, which is good for everyone.

 

About the Position 

The Finance and Accounting Clerk is responsible for accurately maintaining and evaluating invoices ensuring timely payment, tracking organizational transactions, depositing cash receipts, managing vendor records, and supporting a variety of accounting projects and processes with efficiency and attention to detail.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and Cash Receipts

  • Ensure accurate, timely, and efficient AP/AR and cash-receipt processes.
  • Monitor workflows and recommend process improvements as needed.
  • Code, file, and enter invoices, ensuring they are paid on time.
  • Proactively prepare and issue AR invoices and manage payments.
  • Deposit cash receipts.

 

Expense Reports and Invoicing

  • Review employee expense reports, corporate credit card statements, and invoices with accuracy and efficiency.
  • Ensure all submissions are processed promptly and in accordance with policy.

 

Vendor Management

  • Proactively review, update, and maintain complete and accurate vendor records.
  • Manage required documentation, including banking details and W-9 forms.

 

General Accounting Support

  • Assist the accounting team to ensure timely and accurate financial statements for the foundation and its fund holders.
  • Monitor cash balances and update cash schedules.
  • Upload cleared checks from the bank into the finance database.
  • Prepare, enter, and file select monthly journal entries.
  • Assist with preparation for the annual audit 
  • Maintain document-retention processes for the accounting department and coordinate the annual transfer to offsite storage.
  • Maintain certificates of insurance.

 

Customer Service

  • Provide exceptional service to employees, vendors, donors, and nonprofit partners.
  • Deliver timely and accurate information to internal and external stakeholders, including audit confirmation requests and vendor onboarding/offboarding support.
  • Model organizational values and contribute positively to workplace culture.
  • Maintain Asana shared tasks in collaboration with other departments.

 

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • Ability to communicate with the team and different departments in a simple, clear, concise manner that promotes good working relationships.
  • Highly organized with attention to detail and timeliness.
  • Self-reliant, results-oriented, and strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage, collaborate, and develop consensus with peers.
  • Skilled in technology and computers.
  • Ability to think analytically on a wide range of problems and ability to deal with difficult situations in an innovative way.

 

Education, Experience, and Certificates

  • High School diploma or Graduate Equivalency degree.
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience required.

 

Benefits, Perks, and the Fun Stuff

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation of $54,000-$59,000 annually and an extensive benefits package, including dental, vision, retirement, and 100% employer-paid medical coverage. All employees are eligible for an annual bonus, professional development education, and flexible work schedules. We are also conveniently located on the G-line in Old Town Arvada. Oh, and we’re pretty fun, so we think you’ll like working with us. 

 

Workplace Culture

You are valued, and you belong. We are committed to maintaining the best possible environment for our employees where people can show up as their authentic selves and grow with the Foundation. 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

 

We anticipate that the application window will close in 60 days.

title: Executive Assistant and Board Liaison
description_html:
Executive Assistant and Board Liaison

 

The Association of Governing Boards of Universities and Colleges (AGB) is seeking an Executive Assistant and Board Liaison to play a pivotal role at the heart of AGB’s leadership, serving as a trusted partner to the President and CEO and as the essential connection to AGB’s Board of Directors. In this high-energy, proactive role, you will anticipate needs, build strong relationships across the organization, and ensure that executive and Board operations run seamlessly. You will work in AGB’s hybrid environment, spending at least two days each week in our downtown Washington, D.C. headquarters, and collaborating closely with colleagues and Board members across the region. You will be part of a mission-driven organization that values excellence, trust, and impact, and you will help enable leadership and governance that strengthen higher education nationwide.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by a competitive compensation of $90,000-$110,000 annually, depending on experience, and an extensive benefits package including:

  • Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided
  • Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching
  • Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection
  • Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts offered
  • Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off, flexible schedule, and remote work choices provided

 

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

 

To succeed as the Executive Assistant and Board Liaison, you should have:        

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field with 7+ years of experience supporting a President/CEO or senior executive team, ideally within an association or nonprofit environment.
  • Demonstrated experience supporting a Board of Directors and committees, including governance processes, volunteer leadership, and confidential executive matters.
  • Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and virtual collaboration platforms such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams, with the ability to produce polished, error-free materials.
  • Refined written, verbal, and presentation communication skills, paired with high levels of organization, discretion, and attention to detail in a fast-paced, multi-priority setting.
  • Availability for occasional domestic travel within the continental United States and the ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders, including volunteer leaders and cross-functional teams.

 

Your responsibilities as the Executive Assistant and Board Liaison will include:        

  • Serve as the primary liaison to the President/CEO and Board of Directors, managing communications, priorities, and relationships with discretion, sound judgment, and professionalism.
  • Coordinate and support all Board and committee operations, including meeting schedules, agendas, materials, minutes, compliance documentation, and the Board web portal.
  • Manage executive and Board meeting logistics end-to-end, including calendars, venues, contracts, travel, accommodations, registrations, and on-site coordination.
  • Prepare, organize, and maintain high-quality executive and governance materials, including presentations, correspondence, background briefings, policies, and official records.
  • Ensure effective governance processes and continuity, maintaining accurate Board profiles, policies, calendars, orientation materials, and governance tools in partnership with the Governance Committee.


We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

is seeking an

to play a pivotal role at the heart of AGB’s leadership, serving as a trusted partner to the President and CEO and as the essential connection to AGB’s Board of Directors. title: Executive Assistant
description_html:
Executive Assistant

 

Our client is seeking an Executive Assistant to provide high-level administrative and operational support to senior leadership, ensuring daily priorities move forward smoothly and efficiently. In this role, you will coordinate schedules, track commitments, manage competing demands, and serve as a trusted partner to multiple senior leaders. You will thrive by being highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive, playing a critical part in keeping leadership focused, informed, and positioned for success.

 

About Our Client: 

Our client is a mission-driven, member-focused association that supports senior leadership through strong operational execution and administrative excellence. The organization values efficiency, collaboration, and accountability, operating in a fast-paced environment where attention to detail and proactive coordination are essential. With a focus on advancing priorities, supporting strategic leadership, and maintaining smooth internal processes, our client fosters a culture of professionalism, service, and impact.

 

Best-in-Class Benefits and Culture:

Our client values employees’ time and contributions and is committed to supporting their success. This role offers a competitive salary range of $55,000–$65,000, along with a comprehensive benefits package designed to support well-being and professional growth, including:

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Retirement plan with employer match
  • Paid time off and sick leave
  • Paid holidays, including the week between Christmas Eve and New Year’s Day
  • Professional development support
  • Remote work opportunities

 

Our client fosters a collaborative and collegial culture, bringing together a dedicated and engaged team working toward shared goals. They welcome individuals who are eager to contribute, grow, and make a meaningful impact.

 

To succeed as the Executive Assistant, you should have:        

  • Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent professional experience, with 2–4 years in administrative, executive support, or coordination roles.
  • Proficiency with modern productivity tools, including Microsoft Office, project management platforms, and cloud-based document systems, with the ability to leverage technology to improve efficiency.
  • Exceptional organizational, tracking, and communication skills, with careful attention to detail, discretion in handling confidential information, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a remote environment.
  • Experience supporting senior leaders or executive teams, preferably in nonprofit or mission-driven organizations, with the ability to work independently, collaborate effectively, and navigate professional interactions with internal and external stakeholders.

 

Your responsibilities as the Executive Assistant will include:        

  • Provide high-level administrative and logistical support to the CEO and senior staff, including calendar management, meeting coordination, and preparation of agendas and materials.
  • Track and manage tasks, timelines, and deliverables for projects and organizational workstreams, maintaining documentation and shared resources.
  • Support governance and committee operations, including preparation of materials, meeting support, and tracking action items for follow-through.
  • Assist with internal communications, coordination across teams, and the maintenance or improvement of processes, systems, and organizational workflows.

 

 

Join the Team

Step into a pivotal role where your organizational expertise and proactive mindset keep senior leaders and critical projects moving forward. Apply now to make an impact in a mission-driven environment and help shape the future of pharmacy leadership.

 

Our client is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace. It does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment.

 

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

 

We anticipate that the application window will close in 60 days.
